title: Embedded Developer | Gothenburg
description:
Looking for your next challenge as an Embedded Software Engineer in the automotive industry? Keep reading!

  

ALTEN Sweden is currently seeking a skilled and experienced Embedded Software Engineer with strong expertise in C programming and AUTOSAR development to join one of our key clients within the automotive sector, working 100% on-site in Gothenburg.

  

You will be part of a highly talented engineering team contributing to the design, implementation, and integration of embedded software for next-generation vehicle systems.



WHAT DO WE OFFER

* Challenging assignments with leading automotive OEMs and Tier 1 suppliers.
* A strong engineering culture and collaborative international teams.
* Supportive, coaching leadership and a people-first mindset.
* The possibility to explore various industries where our clients operate.
* A personal training budget for internal or external courses.

  

ABOUT THE ROLE


As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, integrating, and testing embedded software components within the AUTOSAR framework. You’ll collaborate with system architects, software developers, and test engineers to ensure seamless software performance and compliance with automotive standards.


Your main responsibilities:

* Design, develop, and test embedded software components using C within AUTOSAR Classic or Adaptive Platform.
* Configure and integrate AUTOSAR BSW modules and RTE.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams for software integration and validation.
* Perform debugging, unit testing, and verification according to ASPICE and ISO 26262 standards.
* Troubleshoot low-level software issues and optimize performance on microcontroller-based platforms.
* Work with CAN, LIN, Ethernet, and UDS communication protocols.
* Use tools such as Vector DaVinci, CANoe/CANalyzer, Git, Jenkins, Jira, and Confluence to manage workflows efficiently.


WHO YOU ARE


We are looking for a proactive and technically skilled engineer passionate about embedded systems and automotive software development.


Your profile:

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years of experience in embedded software development, preferably within the automotive industry.
* Strong programming skills in C (low-level embedded systems).
* Proven experience with AUTOSAR (Classic and/or Adaptive).
* Solid understanding of microcontrollers (Infineon, NXP, Renesas) and embedded hardware.
* Familiarity with Vector tools (DaVinci Configurator/Developer, PREEvision).
* Knowledge of functional safety (ISO 26262) and ASPICE processes.
* Experience with debugging tools such as Lauterbach Trace32 or CANoe.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Nice to have:

* Experience with C++ or Python scripting.
* Exposure to Adaptive AUTOSAR, bootloader development, or diagnostic stacks (UDS, DoIP).
* Knowledge of MATLAB/Simulink for model-based development.

  

ABOUT ALTEN


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies, with over 57,000 employees across nearly 30 countries.


Our engineers work on complex, cutting-edge projects throughout the entire product development chain for leading companies in industries such as Automotive, Energy, Aerospace, Industrial Equipment, and Life Sciences.


In Sweden, we are around 1,300 dedicated professionals across 9 offices — from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.

  

ALTEN has been recognized as one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen for five consecutive years — an award highlighting companies that offer unique career and growth opportunities.


Are you ready to shape the future of automotive embedded systems?


We can’t wait to hear from you.


Building tomorrow’s world today!

description:

ALTEN Sweden is currently seeking a skilled and motivated Fullstack Developer to join one of our key clients within the automotive sector. You will play a central role in building innovative solutions that enable connected services and data-driven applications.


WHAT DO WE OFFER?


As a consultant at ALTEN, you’ll have the opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects with:

* Technical challenges and development opportunities.
* An inspiring community and the chance to contribute to a sustainable future.
* Supportive and coaching leadership.
* The possibility to work across various industries where our clients operate.

ABOUT THE ROLE


As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for developing a comprehensive portal equipped with advanced tools and applications tailored for a diverse user base. Your work will empower in-depth troubleshooting and data analysis across our microservices architecture for connected solutions.

  

Modality: hybrid, with 2–3 days working from home. Office located in Gothenburg.

  

What you will do:

* Develop both backend and frontend components for new tools and applications, following best practices and high standards.
* Deploy, operate, and maintain the portal and its backend services while continuously driving improvements in quality, functionality, and cost efficiency.
* Contribute to the design and evolution of new features, ensuring scalable, robust, and future-ready solutions.


WHO YOU ARE?


We are seeking candidates with a strong technical foundation, excellent problem-solving skills, and a genuine passion for technology. You should be a clear communicator, able to bridge technical and business needs, and thrive in a collaborative, team-oriented environment. Our ideal colleague is curious, driven, customer-focused, and embraces a “can-do” attitude to overcome challenges and deliver impactful results.

  

Your profile:

* 5+ years of professional experience as a Fullstack Developer, including personal or hobby projects that showcase your skills.
* You must have experience within the automotive industry.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, React, React Hooks, Redux, RTL queries, and TypeScript.
* Hands-on experience with microservices architecture.
* Solid understanding of integration architecture, including API gateways and APIs (REST, GraphQL).

* Experience working in Agile environments (SCRUM or Kanban).

Nice-to-have (extra merits):

 **Om företaget**  

Tidy Merch är ett snabbfotat och kreativt print-on-demand-företag i Nyköping. Vi kombinerar personlig service, teknisk integrationsförmåga och snabba leveranser. Våra kunder uppskattar oss för att vi är lösningsorienterade, modiga och lite annorlunda – vi bygger medan vi färdas, och vi har kul på vägen.

**Om rollen**


Som utvecklare hos oss blir du spindeln i nätet när det gäller digitala lösningar. Ena dagen kan du bygga en snygg och funktionell hemsida, nästa dag kopplar du ihop API:er eller hittar ett nytt sätt att automatisera flöden. Du kommer att jobba nära både kunder och kollegor – och ditt arbete märks direkt i resultatet.

 **Vi söker dig som:**


Har logiskt tänkande men också ett kreativt öga för design


Är självgående, snabb och prestigelös


Gillar att hitta nya vägar med AI och data


Har erfarenhet av webb, gärna Shopify & API:er


Kan visa upp något du byggt eller kodat

**Det är meriterande om du har:**


Excel-skills


Erfarenhet av enklare API-integrationer


Känsla för estetik

 **Övrigt:**


Hos oss får du vara med och forma både din egen roll och företagets resa. Du får stort utrymme för kreativitet, nära samarbete med roliga kunder och möjligheten att påverka en hel bransch.  

  

Placering: Nyköping


Anställningsform: heltid, 6 månaders provanställning


Ansökan: Sök via Tillväxt Nyköping

*Rekryteringen görs i samarbete med* *Tillväxt Nyköping**. Urvalet sker löpande och dina svar på ansökningsfrågorna ligger till grund för bedömning av din ansökan. Den tjänst du söker är hos en av de arbetsgivare som Tillväxt Nyköping samarbetar med. Om du blir erbjuden jobbet blir det alltså denna arbetsgivare – inte Tillväxt Nyköping – som anställer dig.*

title: Backend Developer
description:
Hi there! 👋
   

  

 We are Alf – a newly formed tech company within Länsförsäkringar Alliance. With a client base of approximately 2 million households, Länsförsäkringar is one of Sweden’s biggest financial groups. Alf is on a mission to create a secure and sustainable way of living by adding cutting-edge IoT tech to 200+ years of experience from helping customers taking care of their homes.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Backend Developer at Alf, you’ll be part of a cross-functional
 **product team** 
 building backend services for customer-facing IoT products. You’ll work close to both the product and its users, taking responsibility from design to production in a system where backend quality truly matters.
   

  

 Our backend is event-driven, business-critical, and integrated with connected devices. The role suits
 **someone who enjoys working end-to-end** 
 , combining feature development with platform improvements. You’ll collaborate closely with frontend and app developers, QA, and the PM to deliver high-quality solutions.
   

  

 We work in
 **two-week sprints** 
 with daily stand-ups, backlog refinement, sprint planning, demos, and retrospectives. Backend developers join chapter meetings to collaborate, share knowledge, and shape the platform together. We value scalable solutions and place emphasis on test automation.
   

  

 The role includes
 **occasional on-call duties** 
 , which are of course, fully compensated.
   

  

**About You**
 We’re looking for an experienced backend developer with a bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, who thrives in a collaborative team and enjoys taking ownership of their work. You’re curious, solution-oriented, and passionate about writing clean, reliable code. You stay up-to-date with modern development practices and are motivated by making a real impact for users.
   

  

**You bring:**
* At least: 3-4 years of backend development experience
* Experience with event-driven systems
* Experience with REST APIs, PostgreSQL (or similar relational databases), and MongoDB (or similar NoSQL databases)


**Nice to haves:**
* Experience with Node.js
* Experience with RabbitMQ
* Experience with Kubernetes and Docker containers
* Experience with IoT


**About Alf**
 Länsförsäkringar embodies more than 200 years of dedication to create safety for our customers. With Alf, all that experience is being combined with innovative technology to cater the current needs of our clients. It’s a full-service solution providing personalized insights, advice and content, which enables the users to proactively take care of and protect their homes. With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, safety and sustainability go hand in hand.
   

  

 Alf is operated by Länsförsäkringar Trygghetstjänster AB, a company owned by Länsförsäkringar Alliance. This provides a unique opportunity to become part of an engaged and fun team at an innovative tech company, characterised by the agile and dynamic essence of a startup, all while being supported by the stability and strength of Länsförsäkringar Alliance.
   

  

**With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, you will get:**
**🏡** 
 Work-life balance through a hybrid model
   

  

 🏙️ Centrally located office in Stockholm
   

  

 🤝 Collective agreement including pension and insurance coverage
   

  

 🤸 Wellness allowance of 5000 SEK/year
   

  

 💸 Special banking perks
   

  

 🚀…and more, but let us dive into that when we meet in person!
   

  

**How To Apply.**
 Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English. Our selection process is continuous, and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis. Looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*To ensure a high level of trust with our customers, a background check will be conducted at the final stage of the recruitment process.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Flower is Flexible Power. We are a next-gen energy company leveraging AI and machine learning to make renewable energy stable and always available – even when the sun isn’t shining and the wind isn’t blowing.
   

  

 Through smart optimization and trading of energy assets like wind and solar farms, battery systems, and EV chargers, we make renewable energy reliable and predictable, leading the charge towards the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart. Purpose-driven at core. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Software Engineer
 **.**
**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer in the Distributed Assets team, you will build and scale the technical foundation that enables Flower to connect, operate, and optimize thousands of distributed energy assets. You will work across integrations, telemetry pipelines, backend APIs, and platform reliability while contributing to a modern, AI-assisted engineering culture. This role is both hands-on and high-impact, central to Flower’s ability to grow its flexibility portfolio across partners, assets, and markets.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build integrations with partners, OEMs, and energy assets
* Develop APIs, automation workflows, event-driven systems, and monitoring tools
* Design scalable data pipelines for telemetry and performance analytics
* Strengthen system reliability, observability, and readiness for new markets
* Support partner onboarding, debugging, and prequalification
* Contribute to architectural discussions and reduce technical debt
* Operate with full ownership from design → deployment → production monitoring


**Who You Are**
* An experienced software engineer with strong backend or platform skills
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Engineering Physics, or a closely related technical field.
* Self-driven, structured, and motivated by delivering meaningful impact in a fast-moving environment
* Comfortable with cloud technologies (preferably AWS) and distributed systems
* Skilled in building APIs, integrations, or data pipelines
* A hands-on problem solver who enjoys working close to real-world operations
* Good communicator with the ability to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams
* Curious about energy, IoT, and optimization, or excited to learn
* Self-driven, structured, and motivated by delivering meaningful impact in a fast-moving environment
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 30 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Backend developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 Backend & Platform:
   

  

* .NET Framework / .NET Core with C#
* Experience with containerized environments, Kubernetes, Docker
* Helm for Kubernetes package management
* Azure DevOps for CI/CD


 Database:
   

  

* Experience with PostgreSQL and/or Microsoft SQL Server


 Security / Identity:
   

  

* Experience implementing and integrating Keycloak for IAM


 Frontend & Architecture:
   

  

* Micro frontend architecture exposure
* Knowledge of React


**Meritorious**
* WiX Installer (Windows Installer XML) experience


**Application deadline:** 
 07-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Backend Developer Intern
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:**

 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management**

 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.

 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.

 and

 **JavaScript** 
 &

 skills

 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**About Hailey 🩷** 




 During the spring of 2020 Hailey HR was founded. We're a Swedish SaaS HR-tech company that want to digitalise, simplify and modernise the HR industry with our HR-system - join us on our journey!
 



  





**About the position** 
 💼
 



 In the role as Frontend-developer at Hailey HR, you will work in our development team that includes frontend & backend developers. We work closely with Quality Assurance Engineers, UX designers and Product owners to ensure continuous and accurate deliveries of high quality.
 



  





 The role focuses on development in modern JavaScript. The current design is developed in Figma and is based on the Ant Design framework.
 



  





 We’re looking for a person who enjoys the idea of having the code you write published multiple times a day and recognizes the value of automated CI/CD pipelines for building, testing, code analysis, and deployment. You should also appreciate being involved in requirement discussions from a frontend perspective and want to understand customer needs.
 



  





 With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to learn and grow, and you will quickly be able to take significant ownership of your work. For that reason, we value quality, personal initiative, and a commitment to both individual and company development.
 



  





 It's perfectly fine if you are not familiar with the frameworks and patterns used - curiosity and willingness to grow is more important to us.
 



  





**What are we looking for?** 



* Experience: A Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or an equivalent field. Alternatively, a post-secondary education in software development combined with at least one year of relevant experience. Minimum 1 years of frontend development experience.
* Language: Full professional fluency in Swedish and strong English skills, both spoken and written.
* Mindset: Curious and eager to learn, like taking initiatives and thrives in a collaborative team environment.



  





**We believe you are:** 



* Flexible and thrives in an innovative and dynamic environment, where solutions are always open to discussion.
* Enjoy working in a team, pair programming, and see the value of code reviews because you work closely with your colleagues in the team.
* Loving table tennis! (or at least find it okay, it’s a part of the start up culture after all 🏓)



  





**What you will learn/might already know:** 



* HTML
* CSS
* Modern JavaScript & TypeScript
* React & high test coverage



  





**More information** 




**Scope:** 
 100%
 



**Start:** 
 Whenever you’re ready!
 



**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden (on-site)
 



  





 We’re looking forward to hearing from you! 💌 👋

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer – Distributed Storage Systems
description:
**ANIMARUM** 
 is seeking a Senior Lead Software Engineer for one of our clients. You will contribute to the design, development, and operation of highly performant and scalable storage platforms. You will be involved throughout the full lifecycle, including architecture, implementation, deployment, and ongoing maintenance. With us, innovation is about more than code and algorithms – we develop solutions that empower both people and organizations.
 



  





**What You Will Do** 




 ·      Mentor and share your knowledge with a more junior team.
 



 ·      Design, implement, and maintain distributed storage systems, including object, block, and file storage.
 



 ·      Build core components from first principles to optimize performance across the technology stack.
 



 ·      Improve existing storage systems to ensure high reliability, low latency, and efficient resource usage.
 



 ·      Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and incorporate feedback into future designs.
 



 ·      Integrate and maintain open-source components within a growing technology ecosystem.
 



 ·      Contribute to measuring, monitoring, and improving performance, scalability, and reliability benchmarks.
 



  





**Skills & Experience** 




 ·      Strong background in storage technologies and distributed systems.
 



 ·      Proficiency in Linux systems engineering and distributed systems development.
 



 ·      Programming experience in languages such as C++, Go, and/or Rust.
 



 ·      Experience building or enhancing clustered storage solutions in Ceph.
 



 ·      Experience building or enhancing large-scale cloud storage platforms.
 



 ·      Knowledge of Kubernetes, including deployment of highly available services.
 



 ·      Deep understanding of file systems, databases, storage protocols, and hardware interfaces (e.g., NVMe, SATA/SAS).
 



 ·      Knowledge of performance tuning, benchmarking, and optimization techniques.
 



 ·      Strong interpersonal skills; able to communicate and collaborate effectively.
 



 ·      Capable of making independent technical decisions.
 



 ·      Self-driven and motivated to solve complex problems.
 



  





**Why ANIMARUM** 




 At ANIMARUM, it is not just about the job – it is about joining a team where people truly matter. We offer:
 



 • A human-centered culture with a focus on work-life balance.
 



 • Flexibility to combine your career with your personal life.
 



 • Meaningful benefits: wellness allowance (5,000 SEK), company car/bike options, and an SL travel card.
 



 • The opportunity to give back – donate to a charity of your choice each year.
 



 • Competitive compensation and stock options – because our people are our greatest asset.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer, who'll be a core member of our Card Services team, owning the systems that define the Qred VISA experience. Our mission is: solve complex cashflow problems for entrepreneurs, driving activation, retention, and massive transaction volume.
   

  

 Your work focuses on building highly resilient backend systems and scaling our product for new markets. You will drive key technical initiatives; from real-time payment features to personalized, data-driven loyalty programs. If you want high-impact ownership in a fast-moving, mission-critical domain, this is it.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Teamwork and collaboration: Work closely with the team’s developers, Tech Lead and Product Manager to find the best solutions and ensure we meet our goals.
* Test your own code: Take responsibility for the quality of your work by creating and running tests to ensure stability and functionality.
* Drive innovation: With a DevOps mindset, improve our workflows and contribute to the optimization of operations and delivery.
* Promote security and performance: Ensure our systems are secure and perform at their best, even as our user base grows rapidly.


**Requirements**
* Experience: Several years of experience in backend development with Node.js, and familiarity with modern workflows such as DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Relevant backend skills: A strong understanding of RESTful APIs and micro-service architecture.
* Cloud expertise: Experience working with cloud platforms, preferably AWS.
* Testing skills: Being comfortable writing and executing tests for your own code.
* Communicative and team-oriented mindset: You like working within a team, enjoy sharing knowledge and contribute to building a strong team spirit.
* Technical curiosity: You enjoy staying up to date on new technologies and tools in backend development.
* Language skills: Being comfortable using English as your working language and understanding the importance of clear communication in an international environment.


**We highly value**
* Cards and payments experience: If you have previously worked with credit cards, payments or transactions it’d be really valuable to us.


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of great competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in our headquarters in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. We review applications on a rolling basis and while the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Senior AI Developer
description:
**About StoneBeach** 




 Are you an experienced full-stack or system developer looking for new opportunities? At StoneBeach, you will be part of a passionate and dedicated team working on high-impact projects that are used in real world operations.
 



  
 



 StoneBeach develops AI-based products and platforms that help organizations understand, utilize, and make better decisions based on their own data. We work with machine learning, generative AI, and information management, with a strong focus on solutions deployed in industrial environments.
 



  
 



 With more than 20 years of experience in document and information management, StoneBeach has a strong foundation in helping organizations manage complex information flows. Alongside our AI-product development, we run a well-established consulting business where we work closely with customers to design and implement tailored solutions in real operational settings.
 



  





 StoneBeach is currently in a scale-up phase, where we continue to develop an LLM-based platform, ContentCompanion -
 
 an agent-based orchestration layer that integrates enterprise data and connects to pluggable LLM providers,
 
 while also investing in new scalable AI products.
 



  





 We are now looking for senior developers for our internal development team who want to further develop our AI solutions and take technical responsibility for how our systems are designed, built, and scaled.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 The role is broad and technically deep. You will work with:
 



  




* Integrating and orchestrating ML models and LLMs in production systems
* Machine learning for analysis, prediction, and decision support
* RAG solutions where LLMs are integrated with data and documents
* B
 
 ackend development, system architecture, and data integration
* Technical project planning and scalable design of AI solutions



  





 You will be involved in technical decisions, architecture, and product development, working closely with both developers and business users. The focus is on robust, long-term solutions deployed in real customer environments. In this role, you will build smart, scalable solutions grounded in real business needs and take responsibility for key parts of the technical delivery.
 



  





**Who We Think You Are** 




 You are an experienced developer who:
 



  




* Has several years of experience as a full-stack or software developer
* Has hands-on experience with AI, ML, and/or LLM-based systems
* Is comfortable building and maintaining systems used in industrial contexts
* Can take ownership of technical decisions and see the system as a whole
* Thrives in complex problems where data, users, and technology intersect
* Has contributed to systems that are used in business or industrial environment



  





 You don’t need to know everything from day one, but you have deep expertise in some of the areas above and enough knowledge and willingness to learn to collaborate effectively across them.
 



  





**What We Believe You Need to Succeed in the Role** 



* At least a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Strong skills in at least one established programming language (Python, Java, C#, Go)
* Knowledge of server-side logic development, APIs, and database management
* Experience working with and understanding code written by others
* Experience developing and applying LLM and/or ML models
* Comfortable working with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)



  





**Why choose StoneBeach** 




 Work on diverse and meaningful projects with real business impact, while being part of a close-knit team that values trust, learning, and personal initiative. You’ll have a flexible work setup with the opportunity to shape how you work and have real influence over how solutions are designed – your opinion truly matters here.
 



  





 For questions, contact:
 **kevin.siu@stonebeach.se**

title: Senior Software Engineer Java
description:
**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**Key accountabilities** 



* Develops high quality code using the most appropriate techniques e.g. design patterns
* Designs solutions to meet the requirements (business and tech). Able to challenge and proactively suggest improvement to requirements
* Contributes to best practice, pro-actively looks to improve status quo e.g. can the team improve logging, performance testing etc.
* Focused and engaged in team commitments, takes ownership to help the team reach their goals
* Constructively critique solutions and code of peers
* Actively seeks to automate where relevant with a shift left mindset (catch bugs early during development)
* Follows and implements good practices in quality assurance (e.g. BDD, TDD)
* Confidently makes decisions affecting the team



  





**Skills, knowledge and experience:** 



* Can work independently and writes high quality code using appropriate techniques creating performant solutions
* You have experience working with different systems and architectures which you can draw on to contribute to the solutions in your team.
* Strong experience in Microservices, Java related technologies, Spring technologies, Event driven architecture, Solace, Kafka, Databases, Oracle.
* Ability to code review, give and receive feedback
* Ability to break down technical GAP documents/requirements into deliverable work items
* Experienced with automating to improve efficiency and catch defects early
* Good communication skills to work with team and stakeholders
* Understanding and adoption of good practices such as TDD, BDD
* Experienced in incident management
* Experienced in writing, executing and analyzing performance tests
* Ability to effectively represent the team in stakeholder discussions using domain concepts and language
* Understanding of risk assessment and impact analysis
* Good grasp of secure development
* Experienced in working with agile practices and able to suggest improvements to the team's process
* Maintain the team's CI/CD pipelines
* Use appropriate code analysis tools to improve code quality and security

title: Power Platform & M365 Utvecklare
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Pawer Platform & M365 Utvecklare**
**Om rollen**
 Brinner du precis som vi för att utveckla smartare sätt att jobba med hjälp av ny teknik? Då har du säkert inte undgått att Microsoft Power Platform växer ute på marknaden med rekordfart!
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Att bygga moderna, affärsdrivna lösningar som effektiviserar kundens processer.
* Uveckling av appar.
* Automatisering av arbetsflöden.
* Integration av lösningar med Microsofts ekosystem.
* Att agera som teknisk rådgivare och driva lösningsdesign och implementation.


**Din profil**
* 4+ års erfarenhet av utveckling inom Power Platform och Microsoft 365
* Djup förståelse för affärsprocesser och hur de kan digitaliseras med Microsofts verktyg
* Erfarenhet av integrationer med externa system via API:er och Azure-tjänster
* Certifiering: Power Platform Developer Associate eller motsvarande
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur och governance inom Power Platform
* Talar och skriver svenska flytande.
* Power Platform: Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI,Power Pages, Copilots (PVA), Azure Functions, Logic Apps, JavaScript, TypeScript, .NET


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

 Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

 Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

 Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
*Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Simon Karlsson på simon.karlsson@sogeti.se*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Om Sogeti
   

  

 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 19 kontor och 1200 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**TL;DR -** 
 We’re looking for a Solutions Architect to bridge product depth with business outcomes at Lovable. You’ll help customers understand how Lovable fits into their architecture, design solutions that win enterprise trust, and partner with Sales, Product, and Engineering to drive adoption of AI-native software creation.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience in solutions architecture or sales engineering at a high-growth startup
* Deep understanding of technical architectures, APIs, integrations, data flows, and cloud infrastructure
* Strong consultative selling skills – able to map product capabilities to customer pain points and ROI
* Skilled at communicating complex technical concepts simply to both engineering and executive audiences
* Builder mindset – you enjoy creating scalable processes, proof-of-concepts, and reusable frameworks
* Collaborative partner to Sales, Product, and Engineering, ensuring tight feedback loops
* Bonus: experience with AI platforms, developer tools, or enterprise integrations


**What You’ll Do**
* Partner with Sales to lead technical discovery, solution design, and customer evaluation cycles
* Architect Lovable solutions that align with customer goals and technical constraints
* Develop repeatable frameworks for demos, proofs-of-value, and implementation design
* Collaborate with Product and Engineering to influence roadmap priorities and strengthen technical narratives
* Build and maintain technical enablement materials for pre-sales execution
* Serve as Lovable’s technical voice in key enterprise deals, building trust through depth and clarity


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Business Developer
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Business Developer to join our Strategic Development team in the Hydro Generation organization. Becoming our Business Developer, your main mission will be driving strategic projects and developing the Fortum hydropower portfolio to create value in the long term and align with future system and market needs.
   

  

 As a Business Developer, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Assessing the hydro fleet’s capabilities and potential to identify and propose improvements related to flexibility and market performance.
* Developing business cases and investment proposals for new projects that leverage the hydro assets
* Acting as a point of contact and coordinator between Hydro and Corporate Customer and Markets (CCM) to align market and customer needs with hydro strategies
* Coordinate our development project portfolio, including e.g. digitalization, flexibility and sustainability development projects
* Drive strategic and cross-functional projects within Hydro and with other business units
* Staying updated on market changes and new technologies and translating them into opportunities for the hydro business


 This will involve close collaboration with senior team members and key functions within Hydro and other divisions in Fortum. The work will vary from short-term assignments to long-term projects and investigations in the area of developing our Hydro fleet.
   

  

**About You**
 Some of the qualifications we are looking for in the recruitment are:
   

  

* Master of Engineering or Business
* Some years of experience working with the energy market or in a corresponding role in the energy industry
* Skills in managing projects and engaging stakeholders
* Fluent in English
* Experience in hydropower is a plus


 Personal qualifications:
   

  

 You have a thorough understanding of the energy market in the Nordic region. You are proactive and able to have a helicopter view of strategic development and understand a little bit of everything in a short period of time. You should have a strategic mindset and be able to understand how development projects fit into the bigger picture. You should also have change management skills such as the ability to build trust in senior experts and drive change as well as excellent presentation skills.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and Swedish benefits can be found here.
   

  

 More information about our culture and Finnish benefits can be found here.
   

  

 Espoo office is a smoke-free workplace.
   

  

 For permanent employment with Fortum Sverige AB, you may be assigned a wartime posting within the organization. For further information regarding wartime posting, please refer to the Swedish Civil Defence and Resilience Agency.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application latest on 27th of February 2026. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period and may close the recruitment before the last application date. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Lovisa Torfgård, lovisa.torfgard@fortum.com, +46768038798.
   

  

 Contact details to Swedish union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page** 
**.**
 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: VFX Artist
description:
**Do you enjoy creating visual effects that enhance gameplay and bring game worlds to life?**
 As a VFX Artist in our Stockholm studio, you’ll join a small, talented, and supportive team dedicated to creating strategy games enjoyed by millions around the world. Our portfolio includes
 *Legends of Solgard* 
 ,
 *Rivengard* 
 , and
 *Warhammer 40,000: Tacticus* 
 , all built with the player experience at the center.
   

  

 Your work will go beyond particles and shaders. You’ll be shaping moments of wonder, clarity, and excitement for players. Moments that elevate gameplay and make each action feel meaningful. At Snowprint, we believe that kindness, collaboration, and self-leadership are the keys to making great games.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 In this role, you’ll conceptualize, design, and implement real-time visual effects for characters, environments, and UI in Unity. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, artists, and sound engineers to ensure that every effect not only impresses but also amplifies and refines gameplay. From dazzling attacks to subtle environmental details, you’ll use your artistic eye and technical know-how to create visuals that enhance the overall player experience.
   

  

 We believe in ownership and trust, so you’ll have space to experiment, innovate, and push your craft forward. Whether you’re creating textures and flipbooks, authoring shaders, or fine-tuning timing and motion, your work will be key to making our worlds feel alive and immersive.
   

  

 Is this you?
   

  

 You’re an experienced VFX Artist who has highly contributed to at least one released game, ideally on mobile or handheld platforms. You know how to create compelling effects that balance style, clarity, and with performance always in regard. You’re fluently working in Unity and Maya, and bring a strong sense of timing, motion, and anticipation to your effects.
   

  

 Beyond tools and techniques, you’re curious, collaborative, and open to feedback. You enjoy working closely with other disciplines, and you’re motivated by the idea of making effects that don’t just look cool, but truly augment gameplay. Above all, you’re kind, self-driven, and passionate about making great games.
   

  

 You speak English at a professional level and are a good communicator. You are currently located in Stockholm, Sweden. We are unable to support relocation for this position.
   

  

 Where you’ll work
   

  

 Our Stockholm studio is in Södermalm, with a hybrid working model. We work from the office Tuesdays and Fridays, to allow for closer collaboration and socializing, other days it's up to everyone where they feel most comfortable to work. We support hybrid work by supplying you with the right setup and tools.
   

  

**About Snowprint Studios**
 Snowprint Studios believes great games are created by teams of talented, kind and creative individuals in a friendly, supportive and inspiring environment - while maintaining a sustainable life-work balance. For more information on Snowprint Studios go to snowprintstudios.com and follow us on Facebook.
   

  

 At Snowprint Studios, we embrace diversity both in the worlds we create and in our workplace. Join us in shaping the future of gaming!
   

  

* Pocket Gamer Awards 2022 winner ‘mobile game of the year’ and ‘best strategy game’
* Pocket Gamer Awards 2024 winner 'best game we are still playing’ and finalist 'best developer'
* Pocket Gamer Awards 2025, finalist 'best developer'


**Good to know**
 We are an international company with many nationalities working here. Our company language is English and therefore your application should be in English.

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer - Energy Storage Systems
description:
Lyten is leading an industrial revolution through Lyten 3D Graphene™, a breakthrough supermaterial unlocking a new generation of products — from lithium–sulfur batteries and energy storage systems to concrete admixtures, lightweight composites, and next-generation sensors that are revolutionizing industries. Together, these innovations are making a massive global improvement and driving real-world impact across energy, mobility, construction, and defense.
   

  

 At Lyten, we believe the most meaningful careers begin with purpose — and with people who want to make a difference. We’re not just developing advanced supermaterials — we’re about to change the world as we know it, reshaping how energy is stored, how products are built, and how progress is made.
   

  

 We’re entering an exciting growth phase, scaling production across the U.S. and Europe and expanding our team of engineers, scientists, and innovators.
   

  

 Apply now to join our team and be part of something bigger than yourself — where collaboration, creativity, and purpose come together to build the technologies that will define the next century.
   

  

 At Lyten, we’re building the next generation of energy storage technologies that will power a safer, more sustainable future. As a
 **Senior Embedded Software Engineer** 
 , you will play a critical role in designing and delivering the core firmware that runs on our Battery Management Systems (BMS) software that directly impacts safety, performance, and reliability at scale.
   

  

 The role is available in both Gdańsk and Stockholm, where you will work at the intersection of hardware, systems, and data, collaborating closely with hardware engineers, system architects, and data scientists to transform complex requirements into robust, safety-critical embedded software.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the architecture, design, implementation, and verification of core BMS firmware.
* Develop high-reliability embedded software in C, compliant with functional-safety standards.
* Design firmware modules and interfaces for cell monitoring, balancing, SOC/SOH estimation, and protection algorithms.
* Optimize CPU, memory, and power usage to meet real-time constraints.
* Debug complex hardware-software interactions across MCU peripherals (ADC, SPI, I²C, UART, Ethernet).
* Drive software quality through unit testing, automated regression, code reviews, and static analysis (MISRA-C).
* Produce clear technical documentation: design specs, interface definitions, and release notes.


**What You Bring**
* 8+ years of embedded software development experience, including 4+ years in battery-related systems.
* Deep understanding of microcontroller architectures and real-time embedded systems.
* Proven experience implementing battery-management algorithms (cell balancing, SOC/SOH, protection).
* Expert-level C programming skills (MISRA-C:2004/2012 compliance is a strong plus).
* Hands-on experience with Git, CI/CD pipelines, and static analysis tools.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug complex, cross-disciplinary issues.
* A B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Fluent English, written and spoken.


**How You Succeed Here**
* You take full ownership — from concept through delivery — and care deeply about the impact of your work.
* You thrive in fast-paced, international environments and enjoy close collaboration across teams.
* You’re curious, pragmatic, and motivated by seeing your work used in real products by real customers.
* You value quality, flexibility, and continuous improvement, and you bring positive energy (and a sense of humor) to the team.


**Why Join Lyten**
* Be part of a company shaping the future of energy storage
* Play a pivotal role in expanding Lyten’s European presence


**Why Work at Lyten**
 At Lyten, you’ll be part of a team that’s redefining what’s possible in energy, materials, and manufacturing. We’re not just imagining the future — we’re building it today with breakthrough technologies that are changing how products are made and how industries innovate.
   

  

 Our people are the heart of that mission. From world-class scientists and engineers to creative problem-solvers in operations, manufacturing, and commercialization, every member of the Lyten team plays a role in turning bold ideas into real-world impact. We believe that the best work happens when you’re doing great things in the world — with people you like. Collaboration, curiosity, and a shared sense of purpose drive everything we do.
   

  

 What You’ll Find at Lyten
   

  

* A mission that matters: Contribute directly to solving complex challenges in energy, mobility, and materials innovation.
* Cutting-edge innovation: Work on technologies at the intersection of materials science, energy storage, and advanced manufacturing that strengthen energy security and local supply chains.
* Extraordinary people: Join a team of talented, friendly, and down-to-earth innovators who support, challenge, and inspire one another every day.
* Teamwork and culture: Experience a workplace built on trust, respect, and shared success — where collaboration fuels breakthroughs and everyone’s ideas are heard.
* Global impact: Help scale new materials and energy solutions that reinforce industrial resilience across the U.S. and Europe.
* Career growth: Be part of a fast-moving company entering a commercial growth phase, with opportunities to lead, learn, and make your mark.
* Purpose-driven values: Thrive in an environment that celebrates ingenuity, optimism, and meaningful progress — together.


 Lyten offers the opportunity to do the most important work of your career — helping build the technologies that will power the next century of innovation.
   

  

 Join us, and help transform industries, communities, and the planet with friends who share your drive to make a difference.

title: Chinese Community Ambassador for Stellaris
description:
As a Community Ambassador for the China market, you work as a part-time freelancer to support the activation, moderation, and development of the community and audience for a brand. You contribute to the growth and engagement of a healthy, inclusive community by assisting with the execution of the go-to-market strategy and community plan, as well as supporting the management of relevant social media accounts and channels.
   

  

 You report remotely to the Community Manager of the brand and work closely with them in day-to-day operations. You are responsible for the brand media channels assigned to you (BiliBili, Zhihu, WeChat, QQ groups, Paradox Forum, Steam, or others).
   

  

 You are paid as a freelance worker, on the number of effective work hours reported, normally not exceeding 20 hours per week, at an hourly rate defined in your contract.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage and moderate the brand social media accounts assigned to you.
* Act as the bridge between your assigned brand and Chinese players.
* Collect feedback from and engage with Chinese players.
* Analyze social media metrics to assess engagement and growth
* Prepare the text copies to be shared on social media platforms and beyond.
* Localize developer diaries and videos.
* Prepare monthly reports with actionable insights and recommendations.
* Video editing experience for both short and long-form content


**Required Qualifications**
* Native-level fluency in Chinese language and strong proficiency in English and be able to communicate effectively with a western team of developers
* Deep understanding of Chinese culture, internet trends, and social media etiquette.
* Strong interpersonal skills and composure.
* Ability to work both independently or in a team, and manage multiple tasks efficiently.
* Knowledge of managing Chinese social media platforms and how to operate them independently.
* Strong interest and familiarity with Paradox titles, strategy and simulation games.


**Desirable**
* Experience in community-focused projects, like moderating, administrating or leading thriving fan communities and initiatives.
* Proven experience in managing social media accounts, as well as online communities on , Baidu Tieba, QQ groups, BiliBili and other platforms (content production, posting, moderation, etc.).
* Deep interest in deep historical and strategy games
* Experience with translating documents into Chinese language.
* Adept knowledge of Photoshop and other video editing tools.


**Practical information**
* Scope: Hourly-paid, part-time freelance / contracting job
* Reports to: Community Manager and Marketing Growth Manager
* Location: Remote work

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Golang) - Localization Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Building the future of localization at Wolt and DoorDash 🌍
   

  

 At Wolt and DoorDash, we build products that connect people across 35+ countries and more than 30 languages. To make our products truly feel local everywhere we operate, we’re creating a new
 **Localization Platform** 
 - a unified foundation that enables every team to deliver high-quality, localized experiences efficiently and at scale.
   

  

 This is a chance to
 **define the future of how localization works across Wolt and DoorDash** 
 - shaping the systems, APIs, and workflows that bring local context into every product we ship. Our mission is to make localization seamless, reliable, and empowering - helping every engineer and content creator speak to users in their own language with clarity, consistency, and care.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a
 **Senior Backend Engineer (Golang).** 
 In this role, you will design and build the core systems that power our localization platform. This includes string storage and distribution, seamless integration with third-party translation services, and robust developer SDKs and APIs. These systems are critical in serving thousands of engineers and millions of users globally.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 You’ll join a distributed, cross-functional team of backend and frontend engineers, working closely with product and localization experts. Together, we’re defining how localization works across Wolt and DoorDash. We’re designing the systems, APIs, and workflows that power product experiences for millions of users worldwide.
   

  

 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll be key in building our localization platform's core systems. Your focus will be on platform integration and ensuring seamless localization workflows for thousands of engineers across web, mobile, and backend services.
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Design, develop, and operate robust, scalable services that power the localization platform (we primarily use Go, but proficiency in a similar backend language is welcome)
* Collaborate closely with frontend, backend, and mobile platform teams to ensure seamless localization integration into their development workflows by providing Tools, SDKs and APIs
* Partner with product managers, localization specialists, and engineers to deliver a platform that’s both technically sound and user-centric
* Ensure all components adhere to the highest standards of reliability, scalability, and clear documentation
* Contribute to key architectural decisions in the developer platform


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Proven experience building and scaling large-scale localization (L10n) and internationalization (i18n) platforms across diverse client (web, mobile) and backend environments
* 6+ years of software development experience, with a strong background in distributed systems and API design (gRPC, REST)
* Strong proficiency in Golang, or significant experience in a similar backend language with readiness to ramp up quickly
* Proficiency in data modeling and databases
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with attention to detail and ownership from design to operation
* Clear, proactive communication and collaboration across engineering and product teams


 What’s in it for you
   

  

* Impact at scale - your work will power localized experiences for millions of users and thousands of engineers across Wolt and DoorDash
* Greenfield opportunity - build the Localization Platform from the ground up, with end-to-end ownership to influence the technical vision, architecture, adoption, and shape how localization works across our global ecosystem.
* Collaborative culture - work alongside product, content design, and developer experience teams in an environment that values curiosity, kindness, and technical excellence.
* Growth and learning - we believe great engineers never stop learning. You’ll get opportunities to mentor, pair, and experiment in a culture that rewards craftsmanship and initiative.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Salesforce-utvecklare
description:
Är du en engagerad Salesforce-utvecklare med ett öga för detaljer och en passion för att skapa innovativa lösningar? Då kan du vara den vi söker till Stretch!
   

  

 Hos får du arbeta i ett dynamiskt team där din expertis gör skillnad.
   

  

**Så här ser din vardag ut**
 Som utvecklare på Salesforce plattformen kommer du att arbeta med en mängd spännande projekt och kunder med höga ambitioner. Du får arbeta hands-on med olika lösningar och clouds vilket ger dig bred kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

 Vi arbetar i team och du blir en nyckelperson som ansvarar för att utveckla och designa tekniska lösningar i nära samarbete med våra affärskonsulter, projektledare och andra utvecklare. Tillsammans levererar vi effektiva och hållbara lösningar.
   

  

 Hos oss är du aldrig ensam - vi är ett starkt team som tror på varandra.
   

  

**Vem vi letar efter**
* Erfarenhet av Salesforce - Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components och Flows
* Eller minst 4 års erfarenhet som utvecklare inom tex. Java och/eller .Net
* Erfarenhet av REST API, SOAP API och Salesforce API
* Databasutveckling och SOQL
* Erfarenhet av integrationer mot ERP-system eller liknande
* Möjlighet att arbeta i Stockholm eller Göteborg 2-3 dagar i veckan
* Starka kommunikativa färdigheter i svenska och engelska


**Vi ser gärna att du är**
* Kommunikativ – anpassar ditt språk efter mottagaren.
* Prestigelös – söker win-win-lösningar och fokuserar på det gemensamma målet.
* Proaktiv – ser möjligheter till förbättringar och har ett helhetsperspektiv.
* Analytisk – löser problem med långsiktiga strategier i åtanke.


**Och lite om oss**
 Vi på Stretch Customer är ett gäng nyfikna och engagerade Salesforce-konsulter som älskar att göra skillnad – för våra kunder, för varandra och för våra affärer.
   

  

 Hos oss får du vara med och skapa innovativa lösningar som verkligen gör nytta, samtidigt som du växer i ett team fullt av energi, omtanke och entreprenörsdriv.
   

  

 Vi tror på att ha kul på vägen! Oavsett om det handlar om att testa nya idéer, dela kunskap över en “lunch & learn”, eller flytta kontoret för en dag eller två. Tillsammans skapar vi framgång, för oss själva, våra kunder och hela Stretch.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och växer i både Stockholm och Göteborg!
   

  

 Hej från oss på Stretch Customer

title: Senior Utvecklare ((Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central))
description:
Som Senior Business Central‑utvecklare blir du en nyckelperson i att skapa smarta, hållbara och affärsdrivande lösningar för våra kunder. Du arbetar nära både kollegor och kunder, leder tekniska diskussioner och säkerställer hög kvalitet i varje leverans.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Utveckling: Designa, utveckla och implementera lösningar i Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
* Kunddialog: Agera rådgivande expert, förstå kundbehov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar.
* Mentorskap: Stötta kollegor genom vägledning, kodgranskning och best practices.
* Arkitektur: Delta i tekniska beslut kring arkitektur och design för skalbara lösningar.
* Nearshoring-samarbete: Arbeta nära nearshore‑utvecklare och arkitekter för att säkra kvalitet och leverans.
* Dokumentation: Skapa och uppdatera teknisk dokumentation.
* Kvalitetssäkring: Säkerställa testning och validering innan implementering.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Kandidatexamen inom IT, datavetenskap eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i Business Central.
* Starka kunskaper i AL, C/AL och relevanta verktyg.
* God förmåga att kommunicera med kunder och förstå affärsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning eller teamledning är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad.
* Kommunikativ och relationsskapande.
* Självgående med hög initiativförmåga.
* Teamspelare som gärna delar kunskap.


**Vi erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor
* Möjlighet att utvecklas inom försäljning och bygga en karriär hos oss
* Attraktiva förmåner och en kultur som värdesätter samarbete och innovation


 Do you want to become part of the team?
   

  

 Apply directly online with your informative application documents and your earliest possible start date.
   

  

 Do you want more #insideCOSMO?

title: Dynamics365-Utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av genomförda kundimplementationer av Copilot och AI‑drivna assistenter i Dynamics 365 Customer Service och Sales. Inklusive promptdesign, konfiguration och anpassning, samt införande i produktionsmiljö hos kund.
* Integration av Copilot med externa system/datakällor
* Utveckling och konfigurering i Dynamics 365 CE och Power Platform
* Konfiguration av chatbots och agenter via Copilot Studio eller Power Virtual Agents
* C#
* React/Javascript/Typescript


**Meriterande**
* Azure AI Services
* Azure DevOps
* Azure Pipelines
* Vana av agilt arbetssätt


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 12-02-226
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Team Manager inom IT-utveckling till Svea Bank (vikariat)
description:
Vi söker dig med bakgrund inom systemutveckling och erfarenhet av ledarskap som vill ta nästa steg i en roll där människor och teknik står i centrum.
 



  





 Hos oss får du möjlighet att som Team Manager leda och utveckla ett team som arbetar med framtidens finansiella lösningar. Trivs du med att skapa engagemang, bygga en trygg och hållbar arbetsmiljö och verka i en teknisk och regulatorisk kontext?
 



  





 Då kan detta vikariat på 14 månader vara helt rätt för dig.
 



  





**Vad innebär rollen?** 




 Som Team Manager inom affärsområdet Banking Services har du personalansvar för flera grupper av utvecklare som ingår i olika agila utvecklingsteam. Din huvudsakliga uppgift är att säkerställa att teamen har rätt kompetens, förutsättningar och stöd för att kunna ta idéer hela vägen från koncept till produktion. Ditt ansvar omfattar bland annat att leda och följa upp teamens arbete mot uppsatta mål, coacha och stötta medarbetare i deras utveckling samt säkerställa en god, hållbar och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
 



  





 I rollen fungerar du även som en viktig länk mellan IT-utveckling och affären, där du bidrar med ett tekniskt perspektiv kopplat till utvecklingen inom området. Utvecklingsteamen tar stort eget ansvar för produkter och system, i nära samarbete med verksamheten. Utvecklingen av banktjänster, främst för företagskunder, sker huvudsakligen i .NET-miljö.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du ska ha en god grundläggande förståelse för systemutveckling alternativt ha arbetat som Agil Coach eller Systemutvecklare, och därmed förmåga att förstå teammedlemmarnas vardag. Du har ett intresse för eller tidigare kommit i kontakt med självorganiserande team och motiveras av att skapa effektiva team och arbetssätt. Vidare tror vi att du har en god förståelse för arbete i en regulatorisk eller högt kravställd organisation, då det är en del av vardagen på Svea.
 



  





 Som ledare har du förmågan att sätta en tydlig gemensam riktning och har en rak kommunikation, samt skapar ett klimat i teamet där alla känner sig bekväma att säga sin mening.
 



  





**Vidare har du:** 



* Akademisk examen inom IT, Management eller liknande
* Erfarenhet från ledande roll, gärna med personalansvar
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Erfarenhet från bank och finansbranschen är meriterande



  





**Om Svea** 




*Svea Bank är en finansiell koncern med över 2000 anställda och verksamhet i flertalet europeiska länder. Med mer än 40 års erfarenhet är vi stolta över att erbjuda innovativa och hållbara finansiella lösningar till våra kunder. Svea Bank präglas av en familjär företagskultur där varje medarbetare bidrar med sin unika kompetens och engagemang. Vår företagskultur betonar gemenskap, handlingskraft och balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Välkommen att följa med oss på vår spännande resa!* 




  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail. Om du har frågor om tjänsten går det bra att kontakta Sanna Löfgren på
 
 sanna.lofgren@svea.com
 
 . Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt, så skicka din ansökan redan idag!

title: Utvecklare till Cyberförsvarsledningen
description:
Cyberförsvarets ledning söker utvecklare (DevSecOps) till operativa avdelningen.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som utvecklare inom Cyberförsvarsledningen kommer du att arbeta i en operativ miljö där dina tekniska kunskaper och erfarenheter sätts i en både taktisk och strategisk kontext. Tillsammans med dina kollegor kommer Du att utveckla och driva på Försvarsmaktens tekniska utveckling för att förbättra tekniskt stöd för ledning och lägesbild inom cyberförsvaret och för cyberoperationer.
   

  

 Du kommer att deltaga i avdelningens arbete med kravinhämtning, teknisk kravställning och teknisk utveckling tillsammans med andra delar av Cyberförsvaret och Försvarsmakten.
   

  

 I arbetet ingår internationella och nationella samarbeten.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Erfarenhet av utveckling inom komplexa miljöer och/eller IT-säkerhetsområdet.
* Stor erfarenhet av utveckling i speciellt Python (automation, API-integration, pipelines) och JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Eftarenhet som DevSecOps av CI/CD, Git och infrastruktur som kod.
* Erfarenhet av Docker såsom att bygga, härda, felsöka och Kubernetes såsom deployments och nätverk.
* Goda kunskaper om operativsystem och nät såsom Linux och TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP(S), BGP och TLS.
* Grundläggande kunskap om hotmodeller (MITRE ATT&CK) och loggning/telemetry.
* Erfarenhet av tekniskt utvecklingsarbete i cloud-miljö såsom AWS, Azure och GCP.
* Examen från högskola, universitet eller motsvarande kvalifikationer.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Mycket god förmåga att arbeta självständigt.
* Stark analytisk förmåga med god förmåga till problemlösning och struktur.
* Trivs att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med högt tempo och ibland inte fullständig information.
* Mycket god förmåga att samarbeta och kommunicera i både tal och skrift.
