title: Tech Lead / Senior Lösningsarkitekt IT (Nivå 3)
description:
**Kund:** Offentlig aktör inom kollektivtrafik
  
**Placering:** Stockholm (Kungsholmen) – huvudsakligen på plats
  
**Uppdragsperiod:** 9 februari 2026 – 29 januari 2027
  
**Omfattning:** 40 timmar/vecka
  
**Sista dag för nya offerter:** 3 februari 2026 (CET)
  
**Roll/Nivå:** Tech Lead – Nivå 3
  
**Projekttyp:** IT-roller
  
Om uppdraget
  
En större offentlig aktör inom kollektivtrafik söker en erfaren Tech Lead / senior lösningsarkitekt till ett produktområde som arbetar med trygghet och säkerhet för resenärer.
  
Uppdraget är en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av tekniska lösningar som stödjer operatörer inom trygghetscentraler, där video, larm, kommunikation och realtidsinformation används för att hantera både akuta och förebyggande situationer i kollektivtrafiken.
  
Organisationen befinner sig i en fortsatt digitaliserings- och moderniseringsresa, med ökad egenutveckling, AI-inslag och förbättrade integrationer mellan system.
  
Teknisk miljö
  
Applikationer huvudsakligen på Windows
  
  

Backend på Linux (on-prem)
  
  

**Backend:** .NET Core
  
  

**Frontend:** TypeScript, React
  
  

Agila arbetssätt
  
  

DevOps-principer
  
  

Ingen molndrift (endast on-prem)
  
  

Uppdragets innehåll
  
Du leder det tekniska arbetet för ett centralt produktområde och ansvarar bland annat för att:
  
Vara Tech Lead för produktområdet Trygghetsoperatörsinterface (TOI)
  
  

Praktiskt driva DevOps-arbetet tillsammans med utvecklare och UX-specialister
  
  

Säkerställa att utvecklingen följer målarkitektur och teknisk riktning
  
  

**Fungera som rådgivande teknisk specialist inom:**  

Systemdrift
  
  

Teknisk arkitektur
  
  

Utvecklingsinitiativ
  
Utföra viss utveckling samt code reviews
  
  

Samarbeta nära med användare för att förstå behov och omsätta dem i tekniska lösningar
  
  

Teamet består av ca 15 personer (utvecklare, systemspecialister, lösningsarkitekter och tech leads) med hög teknisk kompetens.
  
Profil & kompetens
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är senior Tech Lead och lösningsarkitekt
  
  

Har gedigen erfarenhet av teknisk mjukvaruproduktutveckling
  
  

Är trygg i att leda tekniska team och fatta arkitektoniska beslut
  
  

Har vana av agilt arbetssätt och DevOps
  
  

Är kommunikativ och van att arbeta nära verksamhet och användare
  
  

Arbetsspråk är främst svenska, men även viss engelska förekommer.
  
Placering & arbetssätt
  
Uppdraget utförs huvudsakligen på plats
  
  

**Kontor:** Kungsholmen, Stockholm (Lindhagensgatan)
  
  

Närvaro styrs av teamens arbetssätt och verksamhetens behov
  
  

Utrustning
  
  

**Uppdragsgivaren tillhandahåller:**  

Dator
  
  

Arbetsplats på kontoret
  
  

Konsulten förväntas ha tillgång till mobiltelefon.
  
Tidplan & optioner
  
**Start:** 9 februari 2026
  
  

**Slut:** 29 januari 2027
  
  

**Förlängningsoption:** 1 år + 1 år
  
  

**Omfattning:** 40 timmar/vecka

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
Vill du bli en tidsskapare?
  
Vi söker nu en senior Fullstack Engineer med hjärtat i frontend till vårt utvecklingsteam. Är du den som alltid har koll på de senaste ramverken, van att skriva tester, brinner för pixelperfektion och vill vara med och driva arbetet med vår frontend-arkitektur? Då är det dig vi letar efter!
  
Om Blikk
  
Blikk är ett snabbväxande produktbolag. Våra smarta molntjänster används dagligen av tusentals användare inom många olika branscher. Blikk-teamet består av ett 50-tal vassa specialister som jobbar med allt från systemutveckling till användarstöd, sälj och marknad. Majoriteten arbetar från huvudkontoret i Piteå, men vi har även kontor i Luleå, Stockholm och Göteborg. Därutöver har vi flera medarbetare på distans runt om i landet.
  
Ansvarsområden
  
I denna roll kommer du att arbeta över hela stacken, men ditt primära fokus och din passion ligger i frontend. Vi letar efter dig som inte bara vill skriva kod, utan som vill vara med och lyfta vår frontend till nästa nivå.
  
  

**Du kommer att:**  

Jobba i en teamcentrisk avdelning
  
Vara med och driva vår frontend-arkitektur och se till att vi bygger skalbart, modernt och underhållbart.
  
Agera brygga mellan Design/UX och utvecklingsteamet för att säkerställa att vi levererar en användarupplevelse i världsklass.
  
Arbeta hands-on med nyutveckling i Vue+C# men även i ett nytt projekt med icke-beslutat ramverk.
  
Vara en teknisk förebild i teamet genom code reviews, kunskapsdelning och mentorskap kring frontend-best practices.
  
  

Vem är du och vad har du gjort innan?
  
Vi söker dig som har den tekniska tyngden att fatta vägval och den pedagogiska förmågan att få med dig teamet. Du är troligtvis den som dina kollegor vänder sig till när CSS: en krånglar eller när prestandan i gränssnittet behöver optimeras.
  
  

**Vi tror att du:**  

Har mångårig erfarenhet av modern frontend-utveckling i TypeScript/Elm/Purescript och ramverk som Vue eller React.
  
Har god förståelse för hela stacken och erfarenhet av backend-utveckling och API-design.
  
Har ett öga för detaljer och en passion för UX – du nöjer dig inte förrän gränssnittet känns "rätt".
  
Är van att arbeta med komponentbibliotek och designsystem.
  
Van vid att skriva enhetstester, end-to-endtester och egenskapsbaserade tester
  
Drivs av att skriva ren, testbar kod och har erfarenhet av CI/CD-flöden.
  
Aktivt utforskar AI-verktyg och lämpliga förhållningssätt till dessa.
  
Behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
  
  

Det är starkt meriterande om du tidigare har haft en roll som Lead eller Senior där du varit med och drivit tekniska förflyttningar inom frontend.
  
Goda anledningar att trivas på Blikk
  
Det är viktigt för oss att vi trivs på jobbet och vi vet att vår absolut största tillgång är våra medarbetare! Vår vision är att vi skapar tid för våra kunder, men också våra medarbetare. Kika gärna in i Blikks Playbook för att läsa mer.
  
Placering och omfattning
  
Tjänsten omfattar heltid och löper tillsvidare. Våra anställningar inleds med sex månaders provanställning. För denna roll utgår du från vårt kontor i centrala Göteborg.
  
Ansökan och kontakt
  
Varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten senast 2026-03-02. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan vara tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag. En del kommunikation i processen sker via mail, vi ber dig därför ha uppsikt på din inkorg efter att du skickat in din ansökan.
  
För frågor som rör tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Andreas Berglund, People Manager via: andreas.berglund@blikk.se
  
För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar alla sökande och eftersträvar mångfald.
  
Vi ser mycket emot din ansökan!

title: Konsult med inriktning mot UX- och tjänstedesign
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Professional Galaxy söker en **Konsult med inriktning mot UX- och tjänstedesign** på uppdrag av vår klient.

**Konsulten ska ha:**  

* Minst fem (5) års arbetslivserfarenhet av UX-design, tjänstedesign eller motsvarande användarcentrerat designarbete.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av behovs- och intressentanalys i komplexa digitala tjänster med flera aktörer.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i utforskande och tidiga faser där lösningen utvecklas iterativt.
* Erfarenhet av att visualisera och kommunicera komplex information och processer.
* Mycket god förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska.
**Meriterande kompetens:**  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med informationsintensiva tjänster, exempelvis register, masterdata eller datadrivna lösningar.
* Vana att facilitera workshops och samverka med roller inom verksamhet, juridik och IT.
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta nära arkitekter och tekniska specialistroller.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av UX-design och/eller tjänstedesign inom hälsa och sjukvård.
**Övrig information**

**Arbetsmodell:** Hybrid  

**Omfattning:** 100 % av en heltidstjänst  

**Uppdragsperiod:** 2026-02-23 - 2027-02-2, option 11 månader

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-02-08


Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.  

  

Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Power BI Specialist -Business Intelligence
description:
Vagabond Shoemakers are on an exciting data journey, introducing Power BI across the organisation and building a new, modern data warehouse. To support this transformation, we are looking for a Power BI specialist to join us on a project-based assignment.


In this role, you will play a key part in strengthening our data-driven decision-making. Your main mission will be to help our Business Controllers and Stakeholders get up and running with Power BI, enabling them to develop reports and dashboards that support better and faster decision-making across the organisation. Working closely with our Finance, Sales, Purchasing, Logistics, and E-commerce teams, you will transform business needs into structured data models and comprehensive reporting solutions.

**This is a fixed-term, project-based role lasting 6 to 12 months.** Candidates must be based in Sweden, and the role is mainly carried out onsite at Vagabond Shoemaker’s headquarters in Varberg, with the possibility of occasional remote work.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop reports and dashboards in Power BI
* Structure and model data in the new data warehouse
* Support and enable Business Controllers in developing Power BI reports
* Translate business requirements into scalable and maintainable BI solutions
* Ensure high data quality, clear definitions, and reusable datasets
* Visualise insights in an intuitive, user-friendly way tailored to different business roles

**We believe you have:**

* Experience working with Power BI, including data modelling (DAX), reporting, and visualisation
* Experience working in data warehouse environments
* A strong understanding of business processes, preferably within retail, e-commerce, logistics, or finance
* Experience using AI in relevant environments
* A good sense of UX/UI and the ability to build dashboards that are both functional and easy to understand
* The ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights
* Experience working with data from multiple source systems (ERP, e-commerce, logistics, finance)
* A structured, communicative, and proactive mindset; you enjoy empowering others and making things happen

**How to apply**  

We welcome your application no later than 16/2. Interviews are conducted on a rolling basis; the position may be filled before the application deadline. For questions, contact Head of BPD & IT, Anders Ammilon, anders.a@vagabond.com.

title: Software Engineer within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support health care professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*

 **The position**  

As a Software Engineer with a backend focus, you will be part of a highly skilled, ambitious tech team building **an AI-driven system that operates at the core of clinical workflows**. Cambio Ambient Scribe is an ambient AI assistant that listens to and documents patient–clinician conversations in real time. By reducing administrative burden and saving up to two hours per day for healthcare professionals, the product helps clinicians focus on what truly matters: the patient. *Read more* here.


In this role, you will take **clear ownership of backend design, implementation, and scalability**, ensuring that the system is secure, performant, and ready to scale from a thousand to tens of thousands of users. You will work closely with other engineers with different focus areas, such as frontend/UX, AI, and full-stack.


This is a hands-on role for someone who enjoys writing production-quality code, designing robust systems, and taking responsibility for technical decisions in a complex and meaningful domain.

**Some of the things you’ll do**

* Design, build, and evolve backend services for a mission-critical healthcare AI product.
* Develop and maintain scalable APIs and services, primarily using **Python** and modern backend frameworks.
* Design data models and storage solutions that ensure performance, reliability, and long-term scalability.
* Build systems with **security, privacy, and compliance** as first-class concerns.
* Work with container-based architectures and contribute to CI/CD, observability, and operational excellence.
* Collaborate closely with AI, DevOps, and product teams to deliver a high-quality, end-to-end solution.
* Take ownership of technical decisions and help shape the backend architecture as the product and platform evolve.

**We offer**


At Cambio, you don’t just build software – you build technology that **directly improves healthcare**.


You’ll get the opportunity to:

* Work on a cutting-edge AI product that is deeply integrated into **COSMIC**, Sweden’s most widely used electronic health record system.
* Be part of a small, highly competent team with strong ownership, short decision paths, and a startup mindset within a stable company.
* Influence architecture and technical direction in a rapidly scaling product.
* Grow with the role – both technically and in responsibility – while working on problems that truly matter to society.

**About you**


We believe you are a Senior Software Engineer with a backend focus who is comfortable taking responsibility for complex systems and enjoys solving hard problems. You have a calm confidence in your technical skills, but you’re also curious, humble, and continuously learning.


Rather than checking every single box, what matters most is that you have a **strong foundation and the ability to design and scale backend systems in production**. You enjoy writing code, care deeply about quality, and understand the importance of security and reliability in healthcare systems.

**We see that you tick some of the following boxes:**

* **Strong backend development experience**, with Python as a core language.
* Around **5+ years of professional experience** in backend engineering or similar roles.
* Experience designing and scaling backend systems in production environments.
* You are comfortable using modern AI tools as a natural part of your development workflow.
* Solid understanding of **security principles** in backend and cloud-based systems.
* Experience working with **containers (Docker)** and modern deployment pipelines (CI/CD).
* Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis) and data modeling for scale.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
* Ability to take ownership, communicate technical decisions, and work collaboratively in a team.

**Bonus qualifications**

* Experience with microservice architectures.
* Experience with observability, monitoring, and performance optimization.
* Previous work in healthcare, healthtech, or other regulated environments.

 **Place of employment**: Umeå or Stockholm

**Scope**: Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period

**Additional Information:** The role involves access to sensitive information, therefore a background check will be conducted on the final candidate.


We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.  

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**


Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life**.** Read more about us **here!**

 **A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible -**explore our employee benefits


Learn more about our recruitment process here


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
### **Join the Mission**


At Kaisa, we are transforming life’s most important purchases—like buying a car or a home—into exceptional customer journeys. We believe the future of engagement is driven by AI, but AI is only as powerful as the data it learns from. We are looking for a **Senior Data Engineer** to lead the charge in building the scalable, high-velocity infrastructure that turns millions of interactions into the fuel for our conversational intelligence products.

### **The Role**


This is a pivotal position where data infrastructure meets cutting-edge product strategy. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will take full ownership of our data platform, leading the design of pipelines that don’t just power dashboards, but serve as the foundation for autonomous agents and real-time automation. You will be a high-impact architect, mentor, and strategist.

### **What You’ll Do**

* **Architect Scalable Pipelines:** Design and build robust ETL/ELT pipelines using Python and AWS services to handle high-velocity data.
* **Evolve Data Infrastructure:** Drive the evolution of our data architecture, ensuring it scales from today’s needs to the future demands of AI/ML.
* **Collaborate Cross-Functionally:** Work closely with Engineering, Product and Business teams to translate high-level strategy into technical roadmaps.
* **Ensure Data Excellence:** Define and drive data quality frameworks, automated testing, and validation processes to ensure our "fuel" is always high-grade.
* **Lead Governance & Security:** Implement best practices for data modeling, warehousing, and privacy regulations (GDPR) to safeguard sensitive information.
* **Mentor and Influence:** Shape team best practices and mentor other engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.

### **Who You Are**

* **An Established Engineer:** You have solid experience building scalable data systems and a deep understanding of data warehousing and governance.
* **Technically Proficient:** Hands-on expertise with Spark, Python and AWS (EMR, Redshift, Glue).
* **A "Problem Solver":** You enjoy turning messy, raw data into clean, actionable systems and have experience with streaming technologies (AWS Kinesis, Kafka or similar).
* **A Technology Leader:** You are confident in technical conversations, take full ownership of the results of your work and naturally mentor and coach your colleagues and peers in all things data.
* **Bonus points if you have:**


	+ Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Kubernetes).
	+ A background in data-driven product experimentation or analytics.
	+ Experience contributing directly to organizational data strategy.

### **Our ways of working**


Each team has clear responsibilities and goals and the freedom to collaborate on the optimal design for the products and solutions we build. We want to hear your opinion!


We have an agile approach to processes and teamwork and we constantly evaluate and adapt. Our Product and UX teams are closely integrated with development. We use modern frameworks and the best tools available.

### **Where You’ll Be**


Our roots are in Sweden, but our reach is international. This role is based in our **Stockholm or Uppsala** offices, working in a hybrid capacity. We embrace flexible "business hours" because we know that life doesn't always fit into a 9-to-5 box.

### **Kaisa Culture**


What makes Kaisa a unique place to build a career? Our values aren't just posters on the wall; they guide our daily decisions:

* **Innovate with Agility** – We move fast, think creatively, and adapt seamlessly.
* **Win Together** – Success is a team effort, and we celebrate it as one.
* **Own It** – Accountability drives progress, and we take pride in our work.
* **Champion Sustainability and Diversity** – We foster inclusivity and make responsible choices.
* **Spread the Vibe** – A positive atmosphere fuels great ideas and connections.

### **About Kaisa**


Since our inception in Uppsala, Sweden, we have grown to include offices in London and Paris. At Kaisa, we understand that our greatest asset is our talented and diverse team. We believe in creating an environment that fosters personal growth, professional development, and overall well-being.

**Founded in 2009.**

title: Kravanalytiker
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Högskole/universitetsutbildning 120p/180hp inom IT, elektroteknik, eller annan relevant motsvarande utbildning
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet, varav minst 5 under de senaste 10 åren, som kravanalytiker inom IT, omfattande kravställning av både funktionella och ickefunktionella krav.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som kravanalytiker med agila metoder såsom User stories, MVP, etc
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med kravverktyg t.ex. Jira, Azure Devops.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet, under de senaste 10 åren, av teknisk kravställning av applikationer i IT-miljö med höga säkerhetskrav.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet, under de senaste 10 åren, av kravställning av analysapplikationer som hanterar och bearbetare stora datamängder
* God skriftlig och muntlig kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.

 **Meriterande**  

* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete som produktägare och/eller UX-designer
 **Sista ansökningdatum:** 09-02-2026

 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Infotainment Test Engineer
description:
We are looking for an **Infotainment Test Engineer** for a global automotive company in **Gothenburg.**

**Start is in March 2026, 6 months limited contract to begin with, Possibility of extension after that.**

**Description** The role is for an experienced and hands-on Infotainment Test Engineer responsible for verification of in-vehicle infotainment systems with a strong focus on functional testing of customer-facing features. The engineer will work closely with infotainment function developers, system engineers, UX/design teams, and other verification functions to contribute to high-quality infotainment solutions delivered to European vehicles from leading automotive brands. The role primarily operates at system and vehicle level within the infotainment verification and validation process.


**Assignment Responsibilities:**


* Contribute to the implementation of agreed verification strategies, plans, and test activities for infotainment systems
* Perform functional and system-level testing of infotainment features
* Design, develop, and maintain test cases
* Execute tests both in bench environments and vehicles
* Perform reviews of test basis, requirements, and test cases
* Track, analyze, and report test results, deviations, defects, and verification risks to test leader and project stakeholders
* Participate in test expeditions, including vehicle-based validation in different markets and environments
* Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, including improvements in test methods, tools, automation, and efficiency

**Verification Scope Covers Key Infotainment Domains:**


* Navigation
* Connectivity & Telematics
* Radio / DAB
* Apple CarPlay & Android Auto
* Voice Assistant
* UX/UI
* Digital key
* Mobile APP
* APP Store / Apps

**Required Qualifications and Skills:**


* B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar technical education
* At least 5 years of experience within automotive and/or infotainment testing
* Strong test analysis and problem-solving skills
* Experience with test case design techniques and structured verification approaches
* **Valid Swedish B driving license**


This is a full-time consultant position in **Gothenburg** through Incluso. Start is **in March 2026, 6 months** limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact **Kanika Singhal** recruiter at Incluso.

title: Infotainment Test Engineer with Test Lead Responsibility
description:
We are looking for a **Infotainment Test Engineer (with Test Lead Responsibility)** for a global automotive company in **Gothenburg.**

**Start is in March 2026, 6 months limited contract to begin with, Possibility of extension after that.**

**Description of the assignment** **Infotainment Test Engineer responsibilities (approximately 60% of the role):**

* Contribute to the implementation of agreed verification strategies, plans, and test activities for infotainment systems
* Perform functional and system-level testing of infotainment features
* Design, develop, and maintain test cases
* Execute tests both in bench environments and vehicles
* Perform reviews of test basis, requirements, and test cases
* Track, analyze, and report test results, deviations, defects, and verification risks to test leader and project stakeholders
* Participate in test expeditions, including vehicle-based validation in different markets and environments
* Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, including improvements in test methods, tools, automation, and efficiency

**Test Leader responsibilities (approximately 40% of the role):**

* Contribute to the development and maintenance of verification plans and test strategies for the Infotainment area
* Lead and coordinate daily verification activities within the Infotainment test team
* Support test prioritization, planning, and follow-up of verification activities
* Coach and support Infotainment test engineers in daily work and test execution
* Report test status, progress, and verification risks to management and project stakeholders, and escalate when required.

**The verification scope is primarily at functional level, covering key infotainment domains such as:**

* Navigation
* Connectivity & Telematics
* Radio / DAB
* Apple CarPlay & Android Auto
* Voice Assistant
* UX/UI Digital key
* Mobile APP
* APPstore/Apps

**Qualifications and skills required for the role**

* B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar technical education
* At least 6 years of experience within automotive and/or infotainment testing
* Strong test analysis and problem-solving skills
* Experience with test case design techniques and structured verification approaches
* High communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams
* Valid driving license

**Test leader qualifications:**

* Experience in coordinating or leading verification activities within infotainment or automotive systems
* Ability to plan, structure, and follow up test activities at team level
* Experience in reporting test status and verification risks to stakeholders and management
* ISTQB Advanced Test Management certification or similar is considered a merit

**Personal attributes**

* Self-driven and structured, with the ability to take ownership of verification tasks
* Comfortable working in a dynamic development environment, making priorities and decisions when needed
* Proactive in identifying risks, gaps, and improvement areas
* Transparent and clear in reporting status, progress, and issues
* Strong collaboration mindset with both internal teams and external stakeholders
* Confident in taking a coordinating and leading role in daily test activities
* Ability to drive, motivate, and align test engineers towards common goals

**Other**

* The assignment includes travel
* Test expeditions of approximately two weeks, multiple times per year, are a mandatory and integral part of the role
* Apart from travel, the work is onsite at the office in Gothenburg (Lindholmen area)

  

This is a full-time consultant position in **Gothenburg** through Incluso. Start is **in March 2026, 6 months** limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact **Kanika Singhal** recruiter at Incluso.

title: UX-designer
description:

title: Product Designer
description:
The customer platform built to acquire, service and grow lifelong customers.
   

  

**Product Designer to shape the hardest challenge in enterprise software**
 We’re hiring for a truly outsized opportunity at the intersection of product design, systems thinking, and real-world outcomes. The mission is clear: turn one of the most powerful commercial platforms ever built into something people actually understand, trust, and love to use, and all at scale.
   

  

**Why are we hiring for this?**
 Planhat has spent a decade building an enterprise-grade platform for commercial teams. We integrate data, workflows, automation, AI, and collaboration into a single system that runs some of the most critical processes inside high-growth fortune500 companies.
   

  

 We’re not building surface-level UI or feature-by-feature “solutions.” We’ve built a horizontal platform made up of composable primitives; things like data models, formulas, permissions, automations, AI steps, and collaboration objects. the same goes for our design approach.
   

  

 You’ll join a growing design team and work closely with Product and Engineering to raise the bar: stronger UX foundations, clearer patterns, and experiences that make platform complexity feel simple and trusted.
   

  

**The real problem**
 Before, the challenge was building enterprise software. Today, the challenge is enabling outcomes in environments full of messy data, legacy systems, and real human complexity. And that is why design is more important than ever.
   

  

 Design at Planhat isn’t about polishing screens at the end of the process. It’s about making complex systems feel legible and intuitive, helping users understand what’s possible without overwhelming them, and deliberately shaping the path from a first interaction to real adoption and measurable business impact. It’s also about preserving flexibility without letting it collapse into confusion, so power scales, instead of friction.
   

  

 This is where you come in.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Product Designer at Planhat, you’ll work on some of the most complex product challenges in B2B software:
   

  

* Designing core platform experiences used daily by operators, leaders, and technical teams
* Turning abstract capabilities (data, automations, AI, permissions) into clear, usable workflows
* Collaborating deeply with product managers and engineers from problem framing to shipped outcome
* Building and evolving our design system: reusable components, patterns, and interaction foundations that keep the product consistent, scalable, and fast to ship
* Balancing power and simplicity without dumbing things down


 You’ll work close to the heart of the product: where decisions compound over years, not sprints.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 We’re not optimizing for a specific background, we’re optimizing for product sense.
   

  

 You might be a great fit if you:
   

  

* Think in systems and flows, not just individual interfaces
* Are comfortable with complexity and know how to reduce it without oversimplifying
* Care deeply about usability, but also about strategy and outcomes
* Can collaborate fluently with engineers and product leaders
* Are curious, opinionated, and willing to challenge assumptions
* Have strong UI craft and can design pixel-perfect, information-dense interfaces that stay clear, scalable, and easy to navigate
* Want real ownership, not just tickets in a backlog


 Experience with enterprise software, data-heavy products, or technical users is a plus—but raw ability, judgment, and drive matter more than pedigree.
   

  

**Why this role is special**
 This is a rare combination of:
   

  

* First-on-the-ground design impact in key areas of the product
* A platform with real depth, scale, and ambition
* A fast-moving, founder-minded product and engineering culture
* The chance to shape how AI, data, and automation actually work for humans


 Every week we don’t make the platform clearer and more intuitive is a missed opportunity for customers. We’ve built the engine. Now we’re focused on how it feels to use. If you want to work on a product with real complexity, real scale, and real impact, this is it.

title: Product Designer
description:
At Bambuser, we’re not just building technology, we’re shaping culture.
 



  





**Video Commerce** 
 was born in 2020. Five years later, it’s becoming the most powerful way for brands and consumers to connect, and we’re leading that transformation.
 



 We partner with the world’s most influential brands to turn e-shopping into something alive
 **through video** 
 : interactive, expressive, and story-driven.
 



  





 People don’t want to browse a static grid of products anymore. We want to
 *see, ask, interact, connect with the story,* 
 and buy because the experience leaves no doubt.
 



  





**Design at Bambuser is about creating clarity and connection.** 




  





 We do this by bringing immersive, shoppable video experiences directly into brands’ e-commerce platforms, helping brands boost engagement, increase conversion and deepen loyalty with their customers.
 



  





**About the role**




 You’re a talented UI/UX designer with a strong visual eye and the ambition to grow into broader product and UX thinking. You deliver
 **outstanding front-end-friendly UI/UX design** 
 , you think about how your work drives business and growth, and you thrive in a team environment with
 **high autonomy** 
 . You’re excited by working in a SaaS context, you’re naturally curious about
 **e-commerce and online shopping trends** 
 , and you’re comfortable balancing multiple stakeholders and a high workload. You consistently bring ownership, initiative, and clarity to your design work.
 



  





**What you’ll do**



* Design high-quality UI for product features across our video commerce platform
* Work within and help evolve our design system (Figma-based)
* Support UX work such as flows, wireframes, and interaction design
* Prepare designs, assets, and documentation for smooth developer handoff
* Collaborate closely with product and engineering in a fast-paced environment



  





**What we’re looking for**



* 3–7 years of experience in product, UI, or UX design
* Strong visual skills: layout, typography, hierarchy, consistency
* Experience working with design systems
* Understanding of UX fundamentals and eagerness to grow further
* Experience collaborating with developers and product teams
* Comfortable taking feedback, iterating, and working autonomously



  





**Who you are**



* You're
 *amazing* 
 at collaborating with product, engineering, marketing and leadership, aligning many “heads” while keeping focus.
* You turn ambiguous problem spaces into structured UX solutions, then execute with high-quality UI.
* You understand design systems, front-end constraints, developer handoff, and how to make complexity intuitive.
* You’ve worked in SaaS or e-commerce or product-led growth environments, and you know how design influences conversion, retention and value.
* You’re a self-starter: you proactively drive your work forward, manage priorities and take responsibility for outcomes rather than waiting to be directed.
* You’re a team player: you support and challenge your peers, share knowledge, and contribute to the collective momentum of the product/design organisation.
* You thrive in fast-paced situations: juggling multiple tasks, adapting to changing requirements, and maintaining top design quality.



  





**Curious to see Bambuser in action?**




 Check out bambuser.com to explore how our platform powers shoppable video for brands worldwide. You’ll find product demos (Live, Shoppable Video, Video Consultation and Chat) and stories from some of the world’s most iconic retailers. If you’re excited about shaping the future of video commerce, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and join us on the journey!

title: UX writing expert with a strategic mindset
description:
**Who we believe you are**
 You’re a senior content professional with user experience at your core. You know that words aren’t just decoration, they’re part of the experience, and they help people move forward with confidence.
   

  

 You turn complexity into clarity. You can write microcopy that’s simple, consistent, and human. And you enjoy building the structure behind it: tone of voice, UX patterns, content principles, and decisions that scale across teams, products, and channels.
   

  

 You bring breadth as well as depth. UX writing is your main craft, but you’re also comfortable stepping into broader content roles: shaping web content, sharpening key messages, supporting content strategy and taking responsibility for production, product planning when needed. We work across many types of assignments, and you enjoy switching between product flows and broader communication, without losing the thread.
   

  

 You’re curious about tech and AI. You like tools that reduce friction, strengthen consistency, and speed up iteration especially when many teams, languages, or touchpoints are involved. You collaborate closely with designers and developers, and you’re happy to explore smarter workflows (like terminology support, tone checks, and content QA) when they improve the work.
   

  

**In your assignments, you can expect to:**
* Create and evolve tone of voice and UX writing systems (principles, guidelines, naming, patterns, component-based writing)
* Contribute to broader content work across copywriting, web content, and content strategy from shaping pages to setting direction and improving structure
* Drive or support localization to keep content usable, relevant, and consistent across markets and languages
* Facilitate workshops to build alignment across product, design, tech, brand, and legal so decisions stick
* Own planning and delivery within content workstreams (scope, priorities, coordination, quality)
* Coach colleagues through collaboration, reviews, and shared method
* Strengthen how we deliver content by developing practical templates and AI-supported workflows, for example, tone and terminology checks, scalable guidelines, and faster iteration without losing quality


**Requirements** 
* 8+ years of experience in UX writing/content design, copywriting, content strategy, digital communication, or strategic consulting—with clear hands-on delivery
* Deep expertise in UX writing, with a willingness to contribute across copy, web, and content strategy when assignments call for it
* A track record of creating content that supports both user needs and business goals
* Experience building and maintaining tone of voice, writing guidelines, UX patterns, and scalable content structures
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills, comfortable advising senior stakeholders
* Experience with coaching colleagues and raising quality through feedback and collaboration
* Fluency in Swedish and English, with excellent writing skills in both
* Practical experience in modern content environments, such as:
* Figma (UX writing in design systems, components, and handoff)
* AI-supported writing and governance workflows (e.g., Gemini, Gemini Gems, Custom GPTs, Copilot Agents), used thoughtfully for consistency, terminology, and quality checks
* Editing and production tools such as Grammarly and Canva
* Working closely with developers and content platforms (structured content, CMS, localization workflows, or component-based publishing)
* Comfortable navigating complex organizations and working closely with clients, including on-site collaboration
* Consulting experience is a plus, as is strong commercial acume


**What Curious Mind can offer you**
 We are content consultants born in the digital era, where strategy and thoughtful production go hand in hand. We work closely with our clients and believe in genuine, long-term relationships. As a senior expert, you’ll shape client outcomes, support colleagues’ growth, and help move our practice forward.
   

  

**Here’s what we’re offering:**
* Leadership development opportunities and personal coaching
* Competitive compensation, performance incentives, and comprehensive benefits
* Access to Eidra’s extensive network of specialists across strategy, design, and technology
* The opportunity to influence our direction and help build new service offerings
* A platform for thought leadership and industry recognition
* Flexible working arrangements that support your goals


 Ready to create communication that cuts through the noise, while keeping end users and business goals in focus?
   

  

 If you have questions, contact Marica Rosengren: marica.rosengren@curiousmind.se. If you’d like to learn more about Curious Mind, please visit our website.
   

  

 We interview on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Curious Mind is a Nordic content partner with a global reach, fueled by curiosity. Our team of around 50 content consultants helps brands across the Nordics grow through digital communication, with impact that travels far beyond our borders.
   

  

 We’re proud to be part of Eidra, a carefully selected group of specialist companies. While we each have our own craft, we’re united by a shared ambition: to help our clients become leaders in their fields.
   

  

 Our modern offices in the heart of Stockholm are home to a vibrant community, where we work side by side with our sister agencies.

title: UX/UI-expert till Feelgood i Stockholm
description:
**Designa användarvänliga gränssnitt och utveckla designsystem hos Feelgood i Stockholm**
 Är du en UX/UI-expert med passion för användarcentrerad design? Hos Feelgood blir du en nyckelperson i ett team som utvecklar produkter som ska vara både enkla att använda och lätta att förstå – med användarens upplevelse i fokus. Här får du stort ansvar, möjlighet att påverka och ett nära samarbete med tjänstedesigner, utvecklare och slutanvändare i ett modernt agilt produktteam. Feelgood arbetar varje dag för att skapa friska organisationer. Med över 8 000 företagskunder, hjälper vi idag över 1,2 miljoner anställda till en ökad livskvalité genom användarvänliga och tillgängliga digitala lösningar.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Hos Feelgood erbjuds du ett omväxlande och meningsfullt uppdrag med stort eget ansvar. Du får:
   

  

* En viktig roll i ett tvärfunktionellt team med stor frihet och möjlighet att påverka
* Möjlighet att utveckla produkter som bidrar till ett friskare arbetsliv för både individer och organisationer
* En modern utvecklingsmiljö där du arbetar med hela designprocessen – från UX till UI – och snabbt ser hur insikter omsätts i faktiska förbättringar i systemen
* Möjlighet att få ansvara för ett designsystem och tillsammans med teamet utveckla och forma det vidare
* Samarbete med engagerade kollegor i en kultur som präglas av samarbete, lyhördhet och innovation
* En kultur med hög psykologisk trygghet och balans i vardagen
* Frihet under ansvar och anpassning efter din livssituation


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Arbetar med UX- och UI-design i alla våra appar
* Driver hela designprocessen – från idé till färdig lösning
* Vidareutvecklar vårt designsystem och ser till att det används konsekvent enligt grafisk profil
* Säkerställer användbarhet, tillgänglighet (WCAG) och visuell enhetlighet
* Arbeta iterativt i ett nära samarbete med teamet och verksamhet, alltid med fokus på användarvänlighet


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av Feelgoods digitala utvecklingsteam med placering i Stockholm. Vi arbetar hybrid med tre dagar på kontoret, men med stor frihet att anpassa efter livssituation.
   

  

 Närmast samarbetar du med en tjänstedesigner och frontendutvecklare i enligt kanban med treveckorscykler (2+1). Ni bygger och vidareutvecklar produkter som exempelvis Feelgoods externa webbportal, interna konfigurationsverktyg och appar för ankomstregistrering och kundservice. Arbetet sker i nära dialog med slutanvändare, interna verksamhetsexperter, kundcenter och marknadsavdelning – alltid med fokus på användarupplevelsen.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För oss är det viktigt att vi jobbar som ett lag, där öppenhet och lärande är viktigt. Vi är varandras arbetsmiljö! Du drivs av att lösa problem och ta initiativ för att skapa rätt förutsättningar för vår framgång.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet inom UX/UI och en relevant utbildning i grunden. Du är också trygg i att ta ansvar och arbeta självständigt – samtidigt som du trivs bäst när du får jobba nära andra. Du har jobbat med både wireframes och prototyper, är van vid agila arbetssätt och har förståelse för modern webbutveckling, Du vill gärna arbeta med data- och användarinsikter som grund i designbeslut och har god känsla för detaljer, tillgänglighet och användbarhet.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Senior Product Management Consultant
description:
You’ve got a few years of experience turning big ideas into actionable plans: maybe as a product owner, product manager, or something similar. You know how to bridge the gap between business goals, user needs, and tech. You believe in building the right thing, the right way, at the right time - and you want to spend your days where your curiosity, strategic thinking, and love for making things happen are allowed to flourish.
 



  





 You like things tidy and agile. You’re confident in your ability to prioritize, structure, and communicate, but you’re also open to listening, learning, and adapting. Overtime is rarely needed because you and your team make realistic, transparent plans and help keep scope creep at bay. This gives you the space to focus on what matters: delivering real value and having fun while doing it.
 



  





 You get a kick out of exploring new tech and aren’t afraid of leading the way when there’s no clear path. You like making decisions but don’t need to be the loudest voice in the room - you believe in teamwork and good conversations.
 



  





 You’ll spend most of your time with the clients’ tech teams, but you probably do that today anyway. Translating needs, managing expectations, and turning vague ideas into clear, prioritized backlogs. You’re good at explaining techy stuff to non-techy people and are not afraid to challenge clients’ ideas or plans when needed. 
 



  





 You may have a business degree, an engineering degree, or none at all. What matters is that you’re a curious, easygoing person who likes to get nerdy over lunch - whether it’s about the latest trends in UX, fun new tech, how to paint your wargaming figurines, or the best way to feed your sourdough.
 



  





 You’ll like working at MVP if you enjoy working with great colleagues and interesting clients on meaningful projects, but it helps even more if you like:
 


* Talking about your latest hobby project, which may very likely be getting more of your attention than you care to admit.
* Hanging out after work, engaging in a board game, or sipping your favourite beverage in a corner, looking cool while others duke it out.
* Sharing ideas and talking shop with product people who are as excited about your work as you are.
* … chatting about whatever else makes you excited about your day!



  





 You know that we’ll be working for decades to come, so we owe it to ourselves to make it rewarding and enjoyable.
 



  





 You apply with the blue button at the top.
 



  





 We aim to hire full-time employees, and we employ a 6-month probation period for all contracts.

title: Frontendutvecklare
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Programmering i alla dess former! T ex par-, mobprogrammering eller kanske någon ny kreativ idé som du vill utforska?
* Aktivt delta i beslut gällande produkter, features, arkitektur och affärsmål
* Lärande och kunskapsdelning i både team och organisation


 Att jobba som Frontend utvecklare
   

  

 På SBAB får du möjlighet att förvandla bra idéer till features och skapa en bra balans mellan kvalitet och leverans. Vi kommer att uppmuntra dig att gå utanför din comfortzone, pröva nya teknologier för att växa som utvecklare och självklart arbeta med agila arbetssätt så som Scrum & Kanban.
   

  

 Våra team är uppdelade i produktområden och har en egen produktägare som styr backlogen medan teamet själv driver arkitekturfrågor, tekniska beslut samt hur lösningen skall utformas.
   

  

 Vi söker en svensktalande lagspelare som vill vara med i vårt utvecklarteam och driva frontend utveckling i React.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har minst 5 års erfarenhet från rollen som Frontend utvecklare med kunskap inom Javascript, Typescript och React.
   

  

 Har du dessutom jobbat med designsystem, krossfunktionellt i team med backend/ux, eller jobbat med tillgänglighet är det ett stort plus!
   

  

 Du blir en en del av ett härligt och ödmjukt team som tror på gemenskap och att lyckas tillsammans!
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Tveka inte att söka!
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Bra på att prioritera
* Empatisk
* Inkluderande
* Kommunikativ
* Kreativ


 Annars då?

title: Web Product Owner
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
 



  





 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
 



  





 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to grow ideas in an unconventional environment. At the same time, you’ll work in a culture of ongoing learning and development, allowing you to constantly expand your area of expertise.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As a
 **Web Product Owner** 
 , you will own and manage Dynavox Group’s global websites as a product. You’ll be responsible for
 **roadmap, execution, quality, and continuous improvement** 
 , ensuring our websites meet business needs and deliver exceptional usability, accessibility, brand consistency, and performance across all markets.
 



  





 You will have a chance to manage the web backlog and roadmap by translating defined business and marketing goals into clear and actionable website requirements, while coordinating cross-functional stakeholders and external partners, ensuring global web governance (e.g. adherence to workflows, publishing standards, and design system guidelines) across all markets.
 



  





**Please note:** 
 This is a
 **hybrid role** 
 based
 **in Stockholm, Sweden** 
 . Occasional travel (10–20%) may be required and will be communicated in advance.
 



  





**In this role you will:** 



* Manage the global website roadmap by turning defined business priorities into actionable initiatives and translating stakeholder needs into functional requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Lead the global website roadmap by translating business priorities and stakeholder needs into actionable initiatives, functional requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Provide final quality approval sign-off for website updates, ensuring UX, accessibility, SEO/AEO, and brand standards.
* Partner with development teams, project managers, and vendors to deliver website enhancements, fixes, and releases.
* Identify delivery risks, technical constraints, and compliance considerations and escalate as needed.
* Monitor performance and usability metrics, supporting analytics, testing, and optimization.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We’re looking for an organized and adaptable senior professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, works independently, and brings a service-oriented mindset.
 



  





**Ideal candidates will bring:** 



* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Digital Media, Web Development, UX/UI, Information Systems, or related fields.
* 5+ years of experience managing complex multi-market websites in global or matrix organizations.
* Strong understanding of UX best practices, accessibility standards (WCAG), SEO fundamentals, and web performance.
* Working knowledge of web analytics, optimization, and performance monitoring.
* Hands-on experience with CMS platforms and modern web delivery practices.
* Ability to prepare and deliver clear presentations and excellent communication skills in English.
* Experience collaborating with development teams, project managers, and vendors in agile or hybrid models. Experience with agile methodologies is a plus.



  





**Apply today!** 




 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**Where we stand:** 




 We believe diversity not only enriches our workplace culture, but also gives us a strategic advantage. Working with people from a variety of backgrounds and perspectives helps us all become better communicators, better problem solvers, and better human beings. Our differences make us stronger.
 



  





 Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.
 



  





 Equal Opportunity Employer/AA Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled

title: Customer Journey Orchestration Manager
description:
Do you want to shape how thousands of customers experience a brand – across every touchpoint, every channel, and every moment that matters?
   

  

 In this role, you will own the end-to-end customer journey and turn insight into action, creating experiences that are intuitive, emotionally engaging and truly impactful. If you are passionate about customer-centricity, design thinking and real business impact, this is a role where your work will be felt every day.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Customer Journey Orchestration Manager, you will lead and orchestrate the end-to-end customer journey across channels and lifecycle stages. Your mission is to ensure that every interaction feels coherent, accessible and meaningful – reducing friction and strengthening customer satisfaction.
   

  

 You will define the journey vision, align cross-functional teams and use insights from brand, market and customer data to continuously improve experiences. The role sits at the intersection of strategy, design, insight and collaboration, offering both influence and ownership.
   

  

 You will translate customer insights into concrete journey improvements through wireframes, prototypes and design concepts, and validate solutions through usability testing and user research. Working closely with stakeholders across the organization, you will help embed a truly customer-centric way of working.
   

  

 This role can be located in any of our main offices in Sweden, Finland and Norway.
   

  

*What makes this role exciting:*
* You own the end-to-end customer journey vision
* You influence how experiences are designed across channels
* You work hands-on with journey mapping, prototyping and testing
* You act as a strategic partner to leaders across the business
* You drive initiatives that directly improve customer satisfaction and loyalty


*Key areas of responsibility include:*
* Designing consistent customer experiences across channels and journeys
* Ensuring alignment between internal processes and customer experience
* Translating customer insights into wireframes, mockups and prototypes
* Conducting usability testing and user interviews to validate decisions
* Identifying and quantifying business value opportunities within journeys
* Collaborating with data, MarTech, and analytics teams to operationalize personalization within journey logic
* Service Blueprinting, ensuring that experience design aligns with operational and technical realities


**About You**
 You are a customer experience professional who combines strategic thinking with hands-on execution. You are comfortable navigating complexity, influencing stakeholders and turning insight into practical solutions.
   

  

*We believe you bring:*
* Deep experience in journey design and service design
* Fluency in data, insights and experimentation
* A customer-obsessed mindset
* Experience building and socializing journey frameworks
* Experience in go-to-market environments (B2C, B2B or B2B2C)
* Strong communication skills and the ability to influence without formal authority
* Experience collaborating across functions and leading initiatives
* Fluency in English, and fluency in Swedish, Norwegian or Finnish


**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your CV in English by 8th of February 2026 at the latest . We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact hiring manager Pål Gravdahl at pal.gravdahl@fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to Swedish union representatives can be found on the bottom of
 **this page**
**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. We generate and deliver reliable energy to our customers and the Nordic energy system while at the same time helping industries decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations comprise efficient and best-in-class low-carbon power generation, customer services, and heating and cooling. Fortum’s power generation is already 99% from renewable or nuclear sources with one of the lowest specific CO2-emissions in Europe. We are guided by our ambitious SBTi-validated
   

  

 emission reduction targets on our way towards net-zero by 2040. For our :4,500 employees, we commit to be a safe and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Software Engineer GenAI
description:
Join Neo4j's innovative Generative AI (Gen AI) team, where we build advanced AI and machine learning solutions. As a Software Engineer - Cloud, you will be instrumental in architecting and deploying our products to Neo4j Aura, our cloud platform. You will contribute to both existing and new products as we expand our suite of Gen AI offerings.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

* Infrastructure Design & Architecture: Design and manage scalable, secure cloudinfrastructure on GCP and similar platforms.
* Kubernetes Orchestration: Deploy, manage, and optimise Gen AI applications for Kubernetes, handling deployments, stateful applications, resource scheduling, and troubleshooting.
* Security & Compliance: Ensure adherence to security best practices and compliance standards.
* Troubleshooting & Support: Diagnose and resolve complex infrastructure and application issues.
* Innovation & Research: Stay updated on cloud, Kubernetes, and Gen AI infrastructure advancements.


Minimum Qualifications
  
  

* Strong cloud development experience with major platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) including Kubernetes, containerisation, and distributed systems architecture for scalable Gen AI applications.
* 5+ years of software engineering experience with proficiency in Go, Java, Python, or Scala, and willingness to learn complementary technologies in Neo4j's tech stack.
* Hands-on expertise with generative AI concepts including LLMs, vector databases, RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) implementations, and agent frameworks such as LangGraph, LangChain, or similar
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana).
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.

title: Teknisk Dokumentatör med kunskaper inom GIS!
description:
Besitter du kunskaper inom GIS och vill få möjlighet till en meriterande erfarenhet inom teknisk dokumentation hos ett ledande bolag? Är du noggrann, har ett sinne för struktur och vill vara med och göra skillnad? Då ska du läsa vidare.
  
  

**OM TJÄNSTEN:**  

I tjänsten som Teknisk Dokumentatör kommer du att arbeta i vår kunds egenutvecklade system med att tolka dokumentation och schematiska ritningar mot ledningsnät, till exempel fiberkablar och kanalisation. Du kommer att ansvara för ett geografiskt område med tillhörande filer där du vidare kommer att analysera information och uppdatera detta i ledningssystem. I tjänsten förekommer kontaktytor främst internt men även externt där du kan komma att föra dialog med olika aktörer för att reda ut frågor kring aktuella data inom ditt geografiska område.
  
Du kommer att utgå från kontoret i Göteborg där du blir en del av ett sammansvetsat team om tre personer. Totalt är ni tolv personer i gruppen, varav tre utgår från kontoret i Göteborg och resterande i Örebro. Tillsammans arbetar ni gemensamt med att anpassa er efter fastställt scope och för att komma fram till hur tolkningar ska genomföras.
  
  

**Sammanfattningsvis kommer du att:**  

Tolka teknisk dokumentation och schematiska ritningar mot ledningsnät.
  
Analysera geografisk samt teknisk information och uppdatera i ledningssystem.
  
Samarbeta både externt med kund, aktörer och internt med teamet och kollegor.
  
Komma med löpande förbättringsförslag och idéer.
  
  

Tjänsten är en projektanställning som kommer att löpa till december 2026.
  
  

**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** Har en relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, geografi eller likvärdigt område.
  
Besitter kunskaper inom geografiska informationssystem (GIS).
  
Har en god datorvana samt teknisk förståelse med förmågan att tolka och analysera tekniska dokument.
  
Är obehindrad i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift då språken kommuniceras internt.
  
  

**Det är meriterande om du:**  

Har erfarenhet från en liknande roll som till exempel som teknisk dokumentatör, nätdokumentatör eller motsvarande.
  
Tidigare har arbetat i system som ArcGIS, AutoCAD eller liknande.
  
Besitter en god förståelse för nätuppbyggnad inom telekom alternativt elnät.
  
Har erfarenhet från nätinformationssystem som till exempel IGS/Nice, Digpro dpPower, dpCom, Trimble NIS, Netbas m.fl.
  
  

Som person tror vi att du är driven och effektiv. Du uppskattar att arbeta i ett högt tempo och är inte rädd för att ta för dig. Samtidigt ser vi att du har en god samarbetsförmåga där du trivs med att jobba sammansvetsat med andra. Då du i rollen också hanterar teknisk information och data är det viktigt att du har en god analytisk förmåga samt har ett sinne för ordning och struktur. Vi ser även att du är lösningsinriktad och är nyfiken och hungrig på att lära dig nya saker.
  
  

**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:**  

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer att vara anställd av Friday. Då det är en projektanställning kommer uppdraget att löpa till december 2026.
  
  

**ÖVRIG INFO:** Omfattning: Heltid
  
**Start:** April 2026
  
**Placering:** Göteborg
  
**Rekryteringsansvarig:** Sophie Tisell
  
**Lön:** Fast månadslön
  
  

Ansök genom att klicka på ”Sök tjänst”. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen. Vi lägger även stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
  
  

**OM FRIDAY:**  

På Friday brinner vi för att ge dig som Tech-talang en riktigt bra start på karriären. Genom att lyssna på vad just du vill och drivs av, matchar vi dig med företag och möjligheter som får dig att se fram emot att gå till jobbet.
  
Vi värderar ambition och potential högt och arbetar aktivt för en fördomsfri rekrytering, där alla ges samma chans att lyckas.
  
Vi finns i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Varje år genomför vi över 5 000 karriärmöten och matchar kandidater med allt från globala företag till innovativa startups.

title: IT-tekniker
description:
Om jobbet
  
e-Academyhub,com och 3 infra AS söker personal för anställning…
  
Vi söker IT Tekniker i Jönköping, men även andra orter är välkomna att söka, Som innehar körkort B.

title: Customer Support Consultant – teknisk support och konsultroll inom samhällskritisk infrastruktur
description:
Digpro är en stor innovatör inom geografisk IT och även marknadsledande i Skandinavien. Vi tillhandahåller lösningar för el, telekom, gas, fjärrvärme, vatten samt stat och kommuner - i själva verket alla organisationer som bygger och underhåller olika sorters nät. Vi är fler än 100 anställda på tre olika kontor, där alla arbetar på ett unikt sätt för att göra geografiska data och kartsystem mer flexibla och effektiva.**Digpros produkter spelar en viktig roll i utvecklingen av smart infrastruktur och bidrar aktivt till ökad samhällsnytta. Nätägare i framförallt Skandinavien och UK, och även i övriga delar av världen, använder Digpros programvara för att förvalta sina nät och tillhörande processer. Genom avancerade verktyg och funktionalitet för planering, design, byggnad och drift erbjuder Digpro lösningar för hela nätets livscykel.**

**Vill du arbeta med teknik, kunder och att stärka samhällets infrastruktur genom smarta system? Då kan rollen som Customer Support Consultant hos Digpro vara rätt för dig.**

**Om rollen**


Som Customer Support Consultant är du en del av Digpros support- och konsultteam. Du arbetar nära våra kunder med teknisk support, felsökning och systemanpassningar, samtidigt som du deltar i konsultuppdrag där kundernas behov omvandlas till tekniska lösningar. Rollen är varierad och kombinerar analys, problemlösning och kunddialog.

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**


Arbeta i Digpros supportteam och stötta kunder i deras dagliga användning av våra system.


Använda SQL för att ta fram rapporter och analyser som förbättrar kundernas arbetsflöden.


Genomföra tekniska konsultuppdrag och omsätter verksamhetskrav till tekniska specifikationer.


Arbeta med anpassningar och felsökning direkt i kundmiljöer.


Förstå hur våra kunder modellerar sina processer i våra produkter och stötta dem tekniskt.


Samarbete med kollegor inom support, utveckling, sälj och systemarkitektur.


Fördjupning inom en eller flera av Digpros produkter.

**Du har**


Eftergymnasial utbildning med IT- eller teknisk inriktning, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


Erfarenhet från teknisk support, konsultroll eller serviceorganisation.


God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Lätt för att samarbeta och trivs med många kontaktytor.

**Meriterande erfarenhet**


Erfarenhet av teknisk support, gärna i kundnära eller systemnära roller.


SQL och databaser, gärna Postgres och/eller Oracle.


Programmering eller konfiguration, exempelvis JSON eller Java.


Erfarenhet av GIS, NIS eller nätinformationssystem.


Projekt- eller uppdragshantering inom elnät, telecom, VA eller fjärrvärme.


Vana av att arbeta som konsult.

**Vem du är**


Du är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad med ett genuint teknikintresse. Du kommunicerar tydligt, tar initiativ i dialog med kunder och kollegor och trivs i en vardag med flera parallella uppgifter. Du är nyfiken, lär dig gärna nytt och vill bidra till smartare och mer effektiva lösningar.

**Vad vi erbjuder**


Hos Digpro blir du en del av ett kunnigt och engagerat team som arbetar med teknik som gör samhällsnytta på riktigt. Du får god inblick i våra produkter och processer, möjlighet att utvecklas i din roll och arbeta nära både kunder och kollegor i olika delar av organisationen.


Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.


För att jobba hos oss kan du behöva genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

title: Software Engineer, Test
description:
About Us
  
  

At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.
  
  

FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
  
  

We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
  
  

Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
  
  

The role
  
  

At FDJ United we build distributed systems that handle millions of transactions each day. Our development teams deliver new features on a daily basis, doing thousands of releases every year.
  
  

The Test Navigation team drive quality and efficiency across teams by leading high-risk testing, building shared tooling, ensuring environment stability, and providing training and strategic support.
  
  

Continuously improving our customer experience and time to market are essential for the company's success. Test automation is a strong factor in this work, and we are now looking for another team player for our test automation team with experience in test automation.
  
  

For automation testing, we are using frameworks and tools like Cypress, WebdriverIO, Jenkins & AppliTools.
  
  

You will be a member of the Test Navigation Team. The role involves a lot of interaction and support within the PAM organization, and you will be working together with highly skilled professionals from all over the world, in a very interactive and fast-moving environment. Also, there might be some infrequent travel associated with the role between our various office locations.
  
  

What you will do
  
  

Develop, maintain, upgrade and audit our test automation suites
  
Help teams to build automated test suites in line with FDJ United's testing strategy and following test automation guidelines
  
Provide test automation support to development teams when requested
  
Evaluate and drive adoption of new tools
  
Promote best practices for tests implementation
  
Run trainings
  
Mentoring
  
Improve viability and visibility in the overall test reporting
  
  

How will success be measured in this role
  
  

Fulfillment of OKRs
  
Regular performance reviews with your line manager
  
Acting in line with FDJ United values
  
Successful completion of all relevant training and other compliance activities that support FDJ United's sustainable and responsible growth
  
  

Your experience
  
  

You have a wide experience in the area of testing and have a good understanding of testing and its different parts
  
You have experience in test automation (both testing and development mind sets needed, also development experience is important)
  
You understand business requirements and can transform them into tests and test activities
  
You help set the technical expectations on the whole team by both producing and setting high expectations on the team delivery
  
Agile development
  
Experience with web and/or native apps test automation with JavaScript and tools like Cypress or Appium
  
Experience with Jenkins
  
Continuous Delivery (good understanding of the concept)
  
  

An advantage
  
  

WebDriver.io and Appium
  
REST APIs testing frameworks
  
Experience in UI testing with XCUITest and/or Espresso
  
Visual Testing (AppliTools)
  
Databases (general technical usage)
  
  

Our Way Of Working
  
  

Our world is hybrid.
  
  

A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
  
  

Application Process
  
  

We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
  
  

Details
