We seek to strengthen our position and accelerate the implementation of AI solutions across PostNord. We are now looking for an AI Solution Architect who will play a key role in guiding the design, integration, and scaling of AI capabilities across our business. Join us and help shape PostNord’s AI‑driven future! We offer you a cutting edge Analytics environment and very competent colleagues. If that sounds interesting - apply now!
   

  

**Join Us**
 The Technology Acceleration area within Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape - the foundation for PostNord’s continued AI and data‑driven journey. As an AI Solution Architect, you will translate business challenges into robust, scalable AI solution architectures. You will play a central role in designing end‑to‑end AI systems, guiding engineering teams, and ensuring that AI solutions are secure, maintainable, and aligned with PostNord’s strategic direction.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Engage with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into target AI architectures.
* Design end‑to‑end AI solutions including data pipelines, model lifecycle, APIs, deployment patterns, and operationalization.
* Collaborate closely with data platform teams, domain teams, and AI engineers to ensure solution coherence and quality.
* Contribute to the development of PostNord’s AI Center of Excellence
* Evaluate AI technologies, frameworks, and cloud‑native components to guide architectural decisions.
* Create architectural guidelines, best practices, governance, and documentation to support AI delivery.
* Ensure that AI systems meet requirements for performance, security, compliance, and scalability.
* Support development teams during implementation and help troubleshoot architectural challenges.
* Communicate complex AI architectural concepts to project managers, stakeholders, and non‑technical audiences.
* Contribute to continuous improvement of how PostNord builds, deploys, and maintains AI solutions.
* Facilitate realistic and hype free conversations around AI


**Core Qualifications**
* Extensive experience designing and implementing AI or data‑intensive systems, ideally in cloud environments.
* Strong software engineering background with proficiency in Python, Java/.NET, R, and SQL.
* Deep understanding of cloud architecture principles, including Azure compute, storage, networking, CI/CD, and APIs.
* Experience working with ML/LLM‑based systems and generative AI technologies.
* Ability to design scalable solutions that integrate data engineering, model deployment, and monitoring.
* Strong ability to collaborate across teams and drive architectural alignment.


**Nice-to-have**
* Awareness of AI ethics, data privacy, bias, transparency, and accountability.
* Strong communication and facilitation skills.
* Creativity and curiosity in exploring state‑of‑the‑art AI technologies.
* Experience with modern front‑end technologies (e.g., Typescript/JavaScript).
* Familiarity with Databricks, Azure‑based data platforms, and distributed computing.
* Experience with RAG architectures and retrieval‑augmented systems.


**Language Requirement**
 Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 You have a background in AI, data engineering, or software architecture and have designed complex solutions in an agile team. You enjoy working hands‑on with technical teams while maintaining a strong connection to business needs. You are curious, structured, and committed to staying aligned with state‑of‑the‑art industry developments.
   

  

**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
* Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region, providing postal services to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable. We value accountability, bravery, and commitment, and emphasize teamwork, sincerity, and positive relationships. Our diverse workplace contributes to better business results. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receive your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com

title: Chef de partie
description:
**About TAK**
 Located at the top of Brunkebergstorg, Modern Scandinavian cuisine, influenced by Japanese cooking techniques and flavors. Complex creations that are easy to love. We use locally sourced ingredients carefully selected according to the season. With genuine craftsmanship in every detail, we aim to create a dining experience beyond the ordinary.
   

  

 TAK has restaurants and bars across two floors, focusing on Swedish and Nordic ingredients, combined with techniques and flavors from Japan.
   

  

 At TAK, we strive to take our guests on a memorable journey through the Nordic-Japanese kitchen. With exceptional hospitality, we create unique experiences in our stunning venue. With a strong focus on details and true craftsmanship, we guide every guest with heartfelt and inclusive service at the highest level.
   

  

 At TAK, we live by our core values:
 **Professional, Passionate, and Playful** 
 . Together with all our employees, we aim to create an environment unlike any other – a place you will love being in, feel a deep passion for, and, most importantly, be inspired to do your very best to ensure our guests have an unforgettable experience.
   

  

**Why Join TAK?**
 At TAK, we take pride in pushing the boundaries of creativity and hospitality. Our restaurant is more than just a space for food and drinks - it’s a stage for artistry and innovation. If you’re passionate about food and beverages, service, and elevating the guest experience, we invite you to join our dynamic team.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are seeking a skilled and passionate 'Chef de partie' to join our talented kitchen team at TAK. As 'Chef the partie you will be the face of our kitchen, delivering exceptional service while showcasing a deep knowledge of cooking skills and food preparations. You will play an essential role in creating unforgettable moments for our guests.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Craft exceptional food: Create and plate high-quality dishes and menus, showing TAK’s gastronomy.
* Expertise in cooking: Maintain an in-depth knowledge of different produce and flavors. Experience in different cooking methods.
* Deliver outstanding Service: Provide professional, attentive, and personalized service, ensuring guest satisfaction at all times.
* Maintain standards: Ensure cleanliness, organization, and efficiency in all kitchen operations, adhering to health and safety standards.
* Ownership, accountability, proactivity and pride are the core pillars and the defining values that we are looking for.


**Requirements**
 We are looking for a chef who brings passion, creativity, and professionalism to every shift and meals you create. Candidates must meet the following criteria:
   

  

* Proven experience: Minimum 5 years of experience in high-end kitchens with a focus on premium service and standards.
* Gastronomy knowledge: Documented deep knowledge in food preparations, kitchen techniques and an eagerness to continuously learn and innovate.
* Attention to detail: Ability to consistently deliver high standards in preparation, service and presentation.
* Exceptional communication skills: Confident, clear, and professional interactions with client and team members.
* Work ethic: Reliable, punctual, and committed to exceeding expectations.
* Passion for Hospitality: A genuine enthusiasm for creating memorable guest experiences.


**We Offer**
 As a Full-time Employee At TAK, You Will Also Be Part Of Nordic Hotels & Resorts, Which Comes With Several Perks, Including
   

  

* Healthcare benefits and access to a gym at our sister hotels
* Four complimentary hotel nights per year at any hotel within our chain
* Employee discounts at all restaurants within the group (Strawberry Hotels)
* Employee rates at all hotels within the group (Strawberry Hotels)
* Opportunity to be part of an exciting and expanding restaurant
* Competitive salary
* Career development opportunities


**Employment Type**
* This position is full-time
* Are you ready for a new challenge? This role is available now!


**Ready to Elevate Your Career?**
 If you meet these requirements and are ready to take your career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Apply below and become a vital part of TAK’s journey to redefine dining excellence!
   

  

 Don’t hesitate to send our Head Chef, Hyun Desimpelaere an email at hyun.desimpelaere@tak.se if you have any questions.
   

  

*We are proud members of Nordic Hotels & Resorts – a collection of hotels and resorts for guests seeking unique experiences, whether for business or leisure. Each hotel and restaurant strives for a distinct, independent profile with a strong and recognizable identity.*
*Today, Nordic Hotels & Resorts consists of 40+ hotels and resorts, and we continue to grow. What unites all our hotels is a commitment to offering extraordinary guest experienc* 
 es—always beyond the ordinary.

title: Nordic Regional Demand and Supply Planner
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com
   

  

**Job Function**
 Supply Chain Planning
   

  

**Job Sub Function**
 Demand Planning
   

  

**Job Category**
 Professional
   

  

**All Job Posting Locations:**
 Copenhagen, Solna, Stockholm County, Sweden
   

  

**Job Description**
 JJIM – Regional Demand & Supply Nordics
   

  

 Job description: Nordic Regional Demand & Supply Planner
   

  

 Position organizational context: within Regional Demand and Supply Nordics, part of the Johnson & Johnson Supply Chain (JJSC) of Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicines
   

  

**Tactical Responsibilities**
* Captures tactical affiliate business opportunities and makes sure they are brought to the attention of JJSC management organization
* Acts as the local arm of JJSC to deploy new added value initiatives aiming at increasing the market competitiveness of Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicines


**Operational Responsibilities**
* Manages forecast and replenishment to country specific warehouses for approximately 100 SKUs, with a mix between Dynamic Champions, Core and Value Optimizers for narcotic and non-narcotic products. Including PIMS management and scenario planning
* Manages and plans timely and cost-effective supply of his/her portfolio based upon product life cycle stage and market demand variations
* Manages New Artwork Implementation Planning and Expiry Date Planning
* Proactively alerts local company and EMEA about required escalations or potential supply chain disruptions and create STEMs. Follows up with corrective actions. Reports and explains stock-outs
* Communicates with manufacturing sites to ensure un-interrupted supply to the markets
* Supports, advises, and executes plans for New Product Introduction
* Supports, proposes, and executes plans for Product Portfolio Rationalization
* Functions as a country SPOC for one or more 3PLs
* Initiates destructions e.g., due to SLOB, etc. monthly in SLOB tool. And communicates destruction decisions to one or several 3PLs in the cluster of countries
* Collaborates with commercial and pricing to find solutions for increasing sales where there is excess stock, to avoid SLOB and destructions
* Initiates repackaging to reduce destructions due to artwork (SLOB avoidance) when needed
* Initiates donation requests to reduce destructions due to excess stock when needed
* Responsible to ensure supply of samples to markets in own cluster
* Initiates artwork extensions to avoid stock out when needed
* Maintains Master Data Planning Parameters for ERP- and Planning Systems
* Monitors actual sales vs. forecast, and initiates dialogue with production when needed, through our planning system OMP and via e-mail & Teams when needed
* Monitors KPIs for his/her product portfolio, proposing and executing corrective actions
* Manages intracompany shipments between countries to avoid stock out situations
* Acts in compliance with company policies for trainings and Travel and Expenses guidelines
* Manages monthly Danish Stock Reporting – Amgros requirement
* Manages the Priority Report (maintain, run and communicate)
* Manages the common Supply Chain Mailbox for the cluster
* Drives the Integrated Business Planning (IBP) meetings with Commercial, Controllers and BI agrees on the monthly Consensus Demand Forecast (1-36 months) and compares vs the financial plans. Reviews gaps between finance and consensus demand forecast. Discusses business assumptions with risks and opportunities expressed in units, net sales, and gross profit. Agrees how to close gaps and how to handle SKU mix issues
* Drives and facilitates the monthly IBP Meeting for one country (Integrated Business Planning w. country leadership teams). Collects information from several functions and prepares material for the meeting. Responsible to take minutes of meetings and maintain and follow up an action/decision log.
* Provides insight to the EMEA and Global monthly IBP cycle regarding market scenarios, business assumptions, risks, and opportunities
* Represents supply chain in the preparatory meetings for all financial planning cycles and actively shares information and contributes with the supply chain perspective for his/her portfolio. Attends to the country specific meetings for financial planning
* Has the capability to have the role of a EMEA or Global Subject Matter Expert or Champion in one or several areas, working together with organizations and representatives outside own geographical cluster
* Can represent the Nordic countries, MSM or EMEA D&IM organization in designing MSM, or EMEA supply chain processes when needed


**Competencies To Be Successful In Role**
* Has a degree from university, minimum a B.Sc. or three years equivalent upper education
* Acts with integrity and assumes full responsibility for assigned tasks
* Has strong customer and patient focus
* Great E2E understanding and business acumen. Collaborates across functions and organizational levels to achieve better results for the company (R&D, Finance, Commercial Deliver, Business Quality, Regulatory, Customer Service, Pricing & Reimbursement, Market Access etc.)
* Excellent communication skills to be able to facilitate and drive meetings and discussions. Understands what information stakeholders need to make better decisions and communicates proactively and clearly at all levels in the organization
* Excellent collaboration and stakeholder management skills. Takes initiative and acts in a pro-active way. Actively looks for opportunities to build new partnerships and networks. Represents Supply Chain in a professional manner and understand the importance of quick response times but also knows how and what to prioritize, especially under time pressure. Contributes to building credibility and respect of our function
* Highly developed influencing skills. Influences strategic business decisions, involving LOC leadership teams, finance, commercial and others. Influences decisions based on solid E2E knowledge, expertise in Supply Chain and with E2E opportunities in mind
* Experience and skills in leadership, change management and project management
* Skilled in negotiation and make compromises with other functions to achieve the best possible outcome for the company, sometimes with trade-offs for own function
* An analytic mindset. Able to understand different theoretical statistical models and apply in forecasting and in decisions on what products to focus on.
* Has an open and curious mindset and happily shares and discusses ideas. Displays innovative thinking and ask questions to understand more and explore opportunities across organizational borders (Global, EMEA, LOC) to identify improvements in the flow of products to customers and patients
* Has the necessary IT skills (MS Office, SAP, OMP, Tableau, QlikView; Anaplan etc.)
* Important with solid Excel expertise


**Mindset To Be Successful In Role**
* Feels comfortable working in an international and rapidly changing environment. Adopts quickly to new concepts, processes, and systems
* Contributes to an open and positive team spirit and acts as a role model for the team
* Shows interest in new technologies and investigates how to use them
* Is open for mentoring and coaching and receives and shares feedback in a positive manner
* Displays a Can-Do attitude and a willingness to walk the extra mile to get things done


**Required Skills**
**Preferred Skills:**
 Analytical Reasoning, Business Behavior, Coaching, Collaborating, Competitive Landscape Analysis, Customer Service, Data Analysis, Data Savvy, Demand Forecasting, Demand Planning, Inventory Optimization, Manufacturing Flow Management, Predictive Modeling, Problem Solving, Project Management, Statistics, Supply Planning

title: Consumer Relations Lead Vitamin Well Group
description:
*At* 
***Vitamin Well Group,***
*we provide great-tasting drinks, snacks, and protein products. Our brands Vitamin Well, NOCCO, and Barebells are available across most of Europe, North America, the MENA region, and parts of Asia Pacific. With a revenue of 650 million euros, we operate in over 40 markets, with headquarters in Stockholm and offices in fourteen countries around the world.*
 At Vitamin Well Group’s global headquarters in Stockholm, the Global Product function is responsible for product development, quality, sourcing, supplier relationships, and production capabilities across all brands and markets. As the organisation continues to scale, maintaining and further developing a structured, professional approach to consumer relations is essential.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Consumer Relations Lead** 
 to take end-to-end responsibility for consumer contact across Vitamin Well Group’s brands and markets, ensuring consistent and professional handling of consumer enquiries, feedback, and complaints.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The
 **Consumer Relations Lead** 
 is responsible for the overall setup and development of consumer relations across Vitamin Well Group’s brands and markets. The role ensures that consumer contact is organised as a structured, professional, and scalable function within the organisation.
   

  

 A key focus for 2026 is the continued adaptation, and training related to the implementation of a new software as the group-wide consumer relations platform, supporting consistent ways of working across markets.
   

  

 The position sits within the Global Product function and operates at the intersection of Product Development, Quality, Regulatory, Communications, Operations, and local markets. The role is based at our global headquarters in Stockholm and reports to the Head of Product Development.
   

  

**In Short Your Responsibilities Will Be**
* Lead and prioritise the handling of consumer enquiries, feedback, and complaints across markets
* Oversee and support daily consumer relations work handled by a junior resource
* Act as escalation point for complex, sensitive, or high-risk consumer cases
* Safeguard tone of voice and response principles in line with brand and regulatory requirements
* Coordinate stakeholders across markets and internal functions to ensure effective case handling
* Lead and develop consumer relations processes, systems, and ways of working
* Consolidate consumer cases and data into structured insights to support continuous improvement


**What You Can Expect**
* A newly shaped role representing our most important asset: our consumers.
* Direct, solution-oriented collaboration with teams, functions, markets, and partners
* Responsibility to run your area, make decisions, and maintain momentum as we grow
* A combination of daily consumer matters and longterm development of a group-wide consumer relations setup


**Who Are You**
 You thrive in work that requires structure, precision, and follow-through, while continuously solving problems and moving matters forward. You are detail-oriented without losing sight of the bigger picture and apply sound judgement when handling complex or sensitive situations.
   

  

 You have taken a step into broader responsibility in your career, either through leading complex initiatives, coordinating stakeholders, or taking ownership beyond a single task or market. You collaborate easily across functions and markets and work in a calm, pragmatic, and solution-oriented way, with a strong sense of accountability for both quality and outcomes.
   

  

**Essential Skills To Succeed**
* Experience within consumer contact, customer relations/service, or a similar function in a structured environment
* Experience working with ticketing or CRM systems
* Experience working in an international or multi-market environment, with exposure to cross-market coordination and complexity
* Strong ability to work with detail, accuracy, and documentation
* Fluent written and spoken Swedish and English; additional languages are considered a plus


**Welcome with your application, last day to apply is March 3rd 2026.**
*We will review applications on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last application day. We appreciate LinkedIn, but to get a full picture of your experience, we ask you to also include a CV.*
**Life at Vitamin Well Group**
 Our growing family is made up of over 600 employees, representing a variety of cultures, experiences and diverse backgrounds. This diversity is a great asset as we continue our expansion and evolve our portfolio. At the same time, Vitamin Well is still very much a Swedish company, promoting Swedish values when it comes to both business and people. We treat each other in a fair and equal way, and we respect one another based on our qualities. As we expand Vitamin Well Group’s business, we are also committed to minimizing our environmental impact and continuously strive to lower emissions from for example production, logistics, and packaging.
   

  

 Working at Vitamin Well, we provide a dynamic environment defined by ambition, dedication, and an entrepreneurial spirit. In our action-oriented culture, the ability to make swift decisions is paramount in bringing ideas to fruition. We are committed to fostering an atmosphere where every individual's unique strengths contribute to our collective success. As a health and exercise-oriented company, we inspire an active lifestyle by partnering with top-performing athletes, but we also promote and support exercise among our employees.
   

  

*As part of the recruitment process, we may ask you to conduct a personality test as well as a test that measures logical ability. The purpose of the tests is to evaluate candidates as objective as possible and identify the best possible match for the role. The tests are based on solid research and are taken through our partner Alva Labs.*
